Also, the appearance of some scantily clad women ( on a chilly Sunday afternoon no less) with loud voices and awful facia plastic surgery  was a little odd.  At any rate my group of 6 ladies met for an annual magazine club (we have no time for fictional books as many of us are in grad school) and the place was perfect. Good live music too.

ReWNuptF3uV61ZZ2m4LS0w.text: Unceasingly and increasingly has this been my "go-to" place. The prices, along with the quality of service gets you that little extra something to complete your VIG experience. With their happy hour prices and friendly staff, it takes a lot to say " no" to a stop here for some food or a quick cocktail.   Why not?  Apparently, All are welcome!  Enjoy.  E.

Ts9sbr6jsOknwLfmDs0x1A.text: I've been to the original Vig and although I was a fan of the patio I was not a fan of the service. The service here was a bit better. I loved the vibe of this place and the Arizona room was pretty cool. The area next to the fireplace looks like a great place to hang out and have drinks.   The portions here pretty big, but I ordered the horseradish crusted tilapia and the serving was just right. It came with a quarter of a stuffed mushroom, which was different, but good. The roasted red pepper sauce that accompanied the fish was a great compliment. And the potatoes were yummy too. Everyone else had sandwiches, which were huge and enough for lunch the next day. The crabmeat and artichoke dip was also tasty.   I loved the atmosphere of this place much more than the Arcadia location and although this place is a little further form home and you have to valet, this is the one I will return to. I actually came back the day after my first visit just to have dessert in the Arizona room and so Mike could check it out. He liked it better too!

lUpXCanIhjegSsZCoGSb6g.text: Geez, why have I never reviewed The Vig Uptown? We go there all the time.  This is just an amazing spot. My partner and I wind up here at least once a month for Sunday Brunch. The food, service and atmosphere are perfect, or at least we think so.  The only thing I can recommend is if you order a salad have them put the dressing on the side. Sometimes they use a little too much.   The prices are reasonable and I love supporting local businesses. No boring chain restaurant food here.

9o_7_9QT5csFVTj7UocnXA.text: Probably one ofy new favorite places now especially for Sunday brunch. Oh my, the food was amazing and the drinks were tasty. Even better on sunday they have a DJ & horn player during brunch. Awseome and unique environment. Only downside & reason im giving four stars instead of five is i ordered the vig chelada and they charged an extra $2-$4 if you want corona or modello instead of what comes in it. Just surprised me because those are typical beers people normally drink, not anything fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale Salad w/chicken!
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos

qnWQLLQdP6gWuxhQlW07vw.text: I don't come to the Vig as much as I used to since they switched up their staff. Service wasn't great and the food started to go down hill. Not to mention last time I was there my car was damaged by the valet service they want you to use. (Little known fact you can refuse their valet service and they cannot require you to use it) I left a few messages for Vig management after I tried to work it out with desert valet owner and never was called back. Given all that nonsense I sort of boycotted the Vig...but then I was hungry and at the bar across the street and we will slim on options. We sat at the bar on a Sunday evening and the bartender was very new to the Vig. She by far was the best server I've had there since they liquidated the OG crew. She was personable and attentive. Had she not told us I never would of guessed she was so new. The food was much better then previous visits. It's still not as good as it used to be but I think they are getting better. I won't punish the Vig for my experience with their valet company and owner. I'm glad to see they are improving their staff and food.

bhKw16uUq95ihRfrGP3FzQ.text: I've always been pleased with the food here.  My boyfriend took me here when I first moved to Arizona, it was our second date and we sat outside and had a couple drinks and listened to live music.  The steak salad is my favorite and he really likes the short rib tacos.  The charcuterie board is always a good app.  Definitely one of my favorite places in Uptown!

Bb76LsjGax9h-Kh3_xr5MA.text: I wish I could give more than 5 stars! My husband & I just had our wedding reception here. We rented out the entire large patio (room for 90 people) for 4 hours on a Saturday night. Here's the thing, they did not charge us anything for the space! We only had to meet a minimum for food & drink. We had been shopping around for cool venues in Phoenix for months & this was by far the cheapest option with the most space! They allowed us to bring in a DJ, customize a menu, & they had everything setup up for us. If the money saving aspect & being at a great spot wasn't enough, the cherry on top was definitely the staff! Cesar, the Events Director, was a breeze to work with. He's charming, helpful & puts you at ease while you're trying to plan such a huge event. He took time to respond to all of my emails & calls, & to meet with us in person to finalize details. I don't know how much he makes, but he deserves a raise! The night of our event we had 2 servers assigned to us, Chris & Lacey (not sure if spelled right), they were both friendly, hard working & fun! They made sure we had everything we needed, that the food never ran low & the glasses were never empty! It made the night so much more enjoyable working with such dedicated people! Thank you, Vig Uptown, for helping create a night we will never forget!

LUuRfnimzKii9VBXaENWig.text: Every time I go here it's usually for a work happy hour event with a large party and get great service with Kylie!!! She is awesome! The food is great and love the outdoor-like patio area! Definitely a return customer

IAqaM7MfFKHpQVAhuZTuyQ.text: Ok ok I get what the hype is all about now! This place is pretty cool! This particular location has a great outdoor patio area! Also on this day they were serving half off their bottles of wine! How does that not make you like the place even more already! They have a pretty decent wine selection (mostly the basics) and a nice food selection. You can get anything from nachos to ramen noodles! I have never had ramen noodles at a restaurant before, so I am thinking I will have to try that the next time I come here. We came more for drinks and hanging out then we did the food, so I split the nachos and street tacos with a friend. The meat had a great taste to it, the guacamole was fresh and the chips were nice and crispy! We were here for quite a long time and our waitress was very helpful with drink selections and answering questions, we were even able to sample a few different wines. It was nice that she kept checking back with us to make sure we were doing well, even after we finished our meals.  Great new trendy place to stop in and check out. I am interested in going back and trying more of the food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos and nachos! Yummy!

rHm1fp4mSeD_pYE9KrVjFA.text: This is a really nice place to bring friend & family. The patio is great! I had the "The Chick" sandwich awesome...

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9MBnfwr0sIc9ZYeVCTH6TQ.text: Been here a few times and definitely plan on coming back. Enjoy the brunch they have and the bottomless mimosa (which it worth the extra $$$) is awesome. Also really like changing up the mimosa with different juice like orange or pineapple.  Really love the brunch menu, the corned beef hash was good, but really love their version of a monte cristo (it may be my regular). Also really like the black been burger and fish taco I tried for lunch at other times.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corned Beef Hash
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black Bean Burger with Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their version of a Monte Cristo - VERY GOOD!!!

r3qb7GJ_FC6a8ISzY5G9Ig.text: Undoubtedly the best and my most preferred Vig location in Phoenix. Not only is it close to Luci's Market Place (another favorite place of mine) , but it's also just up the street from my mom's place. It was the Vig's one year anniversary the other night, so my friends and I decided to have dinner here. The restaurant  has a minimalist , trendy and modern atmosphere.  We enjoyed several half off appetizers, 2 bottles of wine, Arnold Palmer ice tea and three kinds of desserts!  (See pictures)  We did order a lot for three people and had plenty of left overs.  They were half off, so how could anyone resist?  I was also able to pick up wifi here and that automatically gets a boost in rating from me.  I'm definitely coming back to bring my mom for brunch next time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half off bottle of wine
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ice Cream and something else
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread Pudding and Vanilla Ice Cream

bfSUEM66Xu0Sti4Zf2qMgg.text: Love the fish tacos with the guacamole salsa. Great wine specials & selection on Sundays. Always great service.

CSedxydU93ulkcPC94bGiw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed our Saturday night at the Big Uptown. Its a trendy nook in a N Phoenix community. It is a hip, laid back, and a community oriented pot that's has a life of its own.  After a few beers and a game of cornhole  I sat down outside in the terrace by the fire pit to enjoy my Chorizo Fundido. Not a fan of Chorizo but this dip was delicious. Then I topped it off with the Vig Ass Burger. It was cooked perfectly w all of the right trimmings.  I highly recommend this place as a date night must.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-VrwY4dOl1dTK22Ws2YSPg.text: The food is consistently amazing and the atmosphere is really fun and casual. A favorite spot for brunch, lunch or dinner!!

cT1IW-JBi5YyNSQRakryuw.text: Dateline: "Uptown" Phoenix. Saturday 3:17pm. After just having hung out at Turf Paradise working on my tan by hanging out in the grandstand, I decided to take my $7.60 in winnings and treat myself to a late lunch at The Vig Uptown. I had been to the one in Scottsdale but not this location and I thought it was worth a repeat visit. The reason was their pozole. I remembered it being flavorful and well... GREAT! So that was what I was going to have. I know that for some reason pozole has become quite trendy. Heck, I believe El Pollo Loco was even offering it as a special side! But it is very good and I was "flush from the track" so pozole was what I was going to have. I arrived at The Vig Uptown and ventured inside. It is very similar (identical?) to the one in Scottsdale. A little dark but has a very nice open air seating area and has a "trendy" yet comfortable vibe to it. I was greeted by the bartender who, at first was a bit "too cool for school". He gave me a water and a menu and then proceeded to chat up the women on either side of me at the bar. Two young ladies placed an order for something they were out of and Mr. B-tender seemed to give them a bit of a hard time when then had trouble deciding what to get instead. They finally landed on an Old Fashioned. B-tender then walked away grabbing bottles and returned a few mins later asking the women what was in an Old Fashioned! Everyone grabbed their phones and hit up Google for the answer. Shortly after that weird moment, Mr B returned to take my order. Well, I did get my pozole, but as a side to their Chorizo Burger that sounded just too good not to try. Mr. B recommended the mac and cheese as a side when I ordered the burger, but gave me a "touche " when I requested the pozole. Apparently he approved. He then went about his duties only to check back with me about 5 mins later to ask me again what I had ordered!!! So I gave it to him again and waited. I had a couple of Blue Moons while waiting. Burger finally arrives and the first thing I notice is that the way I am used to having the pozole served...with the onions, radish, cabbage, etc on the side, is not how it was served here. Everything was already mixed in. Part of the fun of this soup is being able to determine what, and how much, you add to it. It was still flavorful, just different. Different is how I would also describe my Chorizo Burger. It had a weird texture. Not really a burger, not really sausage. The arugula on the burger overpowered it and so it tasted a bit like lawn clippings with a nice mayo sauce. After all was said and done, I was a little disappointed by my visit to The Vig Uptown. Not at all bad, but there are better places out there.  - Knife  (Written by Knife of Knife N Fork. Please check out the reviews by my critic in crime, Fork, of Fork N Knife.)

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pozole side arrived with all the goodies already mixed in. So if you like to do it yourself, BEWARE!
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A Chorizo Burger with a side of pozole. And a cold Blue Moon beer.

ztgyzCOIgpzZlOG5qgf5iA.text: Great place to go. The staff is amazing !!! They really enjoy being there and it is noteworthy ! Oh and the food outstanding

4oBTVCvkPBWGdXQnDgF-Ew.text: Great food, great service.  Every time.  Can't go wrong with the mac and cheese or the pad Thai.

sfqThosX8OzfdDZiEK-XIQ.text: Been to all Vig locations and this one is my favorite! Good service and staff plus a great vibe! Favorites are their Vig Ass burger with sweet potatoe fries and love their Moscow Mules! Their weekend brunches are the bomb!

p1rYcs1ls7fryOhyWCX7Iw.text: A regular spot for us it has a great space and garden patio. The menu is short and sweet. I had the glazed salmon and broccoli and it was great. The Posole is fantastic here btw

qhVmJwi0ELsJPwPOoHezBw.text: Excellent Mac N Cheese, staff is very friendly and great outdoor games to keep the kids busy

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xAVzmTqP1MCJB4csEex5rw.text: We came on a recent Friday night and the staff was so friendly and nice. One of the managers even came by to chat us up. (Noah). He was really nice and welcoming. My husband and I each had the Pozole, and it is some of the best we have been able to find in a restaurant. We did want it served extra hot (temperature) and the staff was every accommodating. . We also wanted it served extra hot (scoville chart) and they were happy to add extra chili to it. We will happily go back for great cocktails and huge bowls of Pozole.

0jLRRj4N_VYbPNut-3TjwQ.text: We came here after a long day of hiking and golfing after a recommendation from a local. Unfortunately our experience didn't live up to the hype. We were sat outside at a pollen covered table that didn't look wiped down and without menus or silverware to start. I thought the dip was great for an appetizer but my fried chicken sandwich was a bit disappointing. It was smashed down very thin and seemed over cooked and lacked an juice or distinguished flavor. I did like how you could do half and half on the side of fries which both were good.

knimbwY4aNaaPMLNr_boGQ.text: Met up with some girlfriends there last night. Sat on their patio. Comfortable atmosphere, comfortable seating. We had dinner and everyone seemed pleased with their dinner. While I am a meat eater, for some reason the Black Bean Burger caught my attention - it was pretty good. The flavor was really good but it was a little dry, which sometimes happens, I would have loved some sort of spicey mustard or maybe honey mustard to have accompanied it. As an adult, I've suddenly got a taste for brussell sprouts (my mom would be so proud) so gave theirs a try, I wasn't impressed (but I'm not a big brussell person, so probably not their fault). Their fries were good and they had quite a few side options, including traditional fries, sweet potatoe fries, mac & cheese, and I think there was something else beside the brussel sprouts. When I first pulled in, it looked as thought valet was the only option. But after I got out of the car it looks like I could have driven a bit further on 16th street to have found the self-park.  Definitely a placed I'd take my husband to, or another group of friends!

NJch5MR7xkMujbyEipSZSw.text: Vig Uptown has my favorite atmosphere of any of their locations.   Like seriously, I cannot think of many places I'd rather lounge in than their backyard. With one of their half-priced bottles of wine on Sunday. With my whole squad playing bocce ball. You probably don't know what bocce even is, but once you see it you'll be like "oh that game this is snazzy".   Comfortable and well-furnished, it's perfect for large groups, which I plan to bring along. You can't miss this uptown gem!

iycgubn8A6Fvfux9FLgMaQ.text: The Vig was absolutely fantastic! The restaurant was beautiful  the outdoor area was so inviting with plenty of room, the staff was very friendly always with a warm smile, our waitress Lynn was so awesome made sure we had everything we needed, I found my new Favorite spot i surely will be returning! Thank you :)

5F7FVlzYyXXBmhNy6ePiuw.text: The food was okay. The calamari was not great. It was pretty flavorless.  The biggest issue I had that brought this down to 3 stars was that when my husband and I went, we were being attacked by mosquitos, to the extent that when our food came, we asked for to go boxes and ate our food at home.   Server was also just mediocre.

KsQAvavXzRmqubeJN0OCqA.text: 5 stars exclusively for Caleb! Came Monday night for the burger special and he went above and beyond with guest service. He always had a smile on his face, seemed enthusiastic about the food and the menu, and had a great personality. Caleb made our second time at the Vig wayyyy better than the first! We might come to this location more now than choosing to go downtown. The food was good, service was quick and friendly, and ambiance was nice.

DdDUuF5xop7ctwbllEWURg.text: I'm disappointed to write this because I was really, really excited about going here. One because i like their happy hour menu. Two, it's walking distance from my apartment. I got here at 5 o'clock on Monday for Happy hour. I waited for about 15 minutes for a drink but had good company so it was fine :) we ordered our drinks and asked to wait to order to have a chance to look at the menu. At 5:55 we still hadn't seen our waitress (since 5:15) and wanted to order another happy hour drink before it ended and order dinner but still hadn't seen her. The table next to us mentioned they'd been waiting for 45 minutes and hadn't received any drinks or food or anything yet (but their food came out after). Around 6:20, I stopped another server and asked about just getting our check because we'd been there for around an hour and hadn't had the chance to order dinner. We paid our bill and left. It's just crazy that no one offered to take our order then when I mentioned it. Or offer an appetizer. Or even something as simple as an apology? Or really anything. I don't expect free food but I also don't feel like I should have to flag someone down after an hour just to pay my bill. It was a super disappointing experience. I likely won't be trying it again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coug cup

22wnXCoVUFT8VAILP7HZWw.text: Do you like turkey? Have the turkey sandwich; it's incredible! There's a secret ingredient that makes this entree heavenly. Maybe it is the coleslaw that adds a crunchy sensation to the sandwich. Maybe it is the yummy cranberry chutney that is spread on. Maybe it's the turkey that my waiter said was leftover from his turkey Thanksgiving (yes, he said that jokingly). Maybe it is the pretzel bun (I swore I'd never eat another one but this one didn't swell in my stomach making me cry for three days--nope, not this time). What a great combination of flavors!  I prefer my Brussels sprouts steamed,, rather than roasted. They were good, just not my love.  Our waiter was clever and attentive.   Great place to have dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Incredible turkey sandwich with side of roasted Brussels sprouts

UwzoTOqi8jIZG5inRRQqTA.text: I come here for lunch or dinner sometimes but especially love it for later night meals and drinks. Always consistently good food and service. Michelle the bartender is super friendly, fast at service and makes great drinks! There is a different smaller menu in the evenings ( they changed it recently and I do miss the late night nachos) but still has good selections.  As far as the regular menu I love the salmon, the Greek salad, the nachos and then artichoke dip.  Picture below is the nachos, Edamame and the artichoke dip

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LnyDXpyTO9KzkmGUyHyAmw.text: My husband and I popped in here after an event in the area and had a delicious dinner! I started with a glass of their house Chardonnay (9 oz pour, duh!) and loved it! Typically house wines aren't the best but The Vig has great taste!   I'm not sure what I love more, the cozy vibes or the comfort food! We nestled in to a spacious booth (yes we were that obnoxious couple that sat on the same side) and were excited for a lovely date night! We split the mac and cheese with broccoli and the Pad Thai. Both were just what we needed on a chilly winter evening! The mac is one of my favorites in town - i've been ordering it for years. We even had a decent amount of each for leftovers the next day! The restaurant was PACKED for a Thursday night and we still scored great seat and attentive service.   We live near the Arcadia location but will definitely come back here when in the area! Thanks for another 5-star experience, The Vig team!

eUKaZCBoqclcsNhagLgc0Q.text: Absolutely delicious. Came here for a post graduation party and it was a great decision! Our server Eric was very accommodating and awesome. He helped with the menu and even pulled a few strings to get us an awesome avocado toast after the brunch hours.   On top of that, the food was great - we started with the chips (salted) and guac, along with the calamari (which was to die for). I had the Big Turkey Sandwich and wow. 10/10 recommend. My sister had the poke bowl and it was massive.   The atmosphere was very chill. It was quiet during the lunch hour and super casual. Definitely a spot to take the parents. Totally recommend.

mr0cTzdpFYrxgXw657uzKA.text: We recently moved nearby and this is one of our favorite hangout spots. I haven't had anything bad food or drink-wise. The ribeye tacos are my favorite! We've also been here for brunch on Sunday with our kids and the food was amazing and it was a nice experience. Very cool, friendly bartenders and wait staff. Really chill vibe day or night.

l4HPpOMoIPnfPC-X9NynXw.text: Came here on a Saturday night. When you first drive in, your only option is valet. We were told there's a side lot where you can park yourself. The valet is free, so we just used it.   We requested to sit outside but there was too long of a wait for it. So we opted to sit by the fireplace. This was nice, because it gave us the feeling of being outside with the large windows and foliage. The tables were loungey type tables rather than dinner type tables; the only downside. Stooping over to eat is not my favorite.  We ordered the veggie burger with fries and the Mac and cheese. The burger was good in my opinion. The SO didn't like the red peppers but I think it all worked very well. The fries looked shrimpy and sad, but they were actually very tasty. The Mac and cheese was....okay. It was plain and a bit liquidy. Lacked flavor with the exception of a stronger milky flavor.   I liked this place. It seems like a cool place to hang out with friends. They also had a little bocce ball area that was dominated by a group of kids. I think I'd come back for their burger.

ZlDDBE0V6V4SEuWGSs0Yxw.text: **Update. after posting the previous review, the management team reached out and invited me back. The food was good quality, service was really great.

8tCRkFe-PXsrao2qUG0T9A.text: The Vig is a perfect place to meet up with your friends and do a nice sunny Brunch. You can buy a bottle of champagne and there are purees you can mix in. I am tired of orange juice so having a pineapple option with mango or passion fruit is a life saver. You know, I don't really recall much of the food because I'm so busy drinking and gossiping with my friends but the cinnamon roll is heavenly. The only thing that would make the Vig perfect is a DJ playing some hits in the background. I love the place

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MgzkE-hsvLuSuizPC3Ix7A.text: LOVE THE VIG. I've only been to uptown, but they've got 2 other locations. I went with a big group of friends before some of us had to head back home. For brunch, apps and drinks for 6 of us, the bill was around $240 including gratuity since we were in a larger party. I'm from the bay, so $240 would have only fed about half of us in Oakland. And we were like drunk, drunk and full as hell by the time we were hailing our Lyft.  Phoenix is my home away from home and the staff and vibe at the vig uptown just make me feel even more welcome. Everything was so delicious and they were so accommodating it was truly amazing. I'll definitely be back, more than likely to this vig specifically. Cant wait for my next trip

9NWA1hl7TCTIHOSPo48CxA.text: A pretty good restaurant in the neighborhood. They have a nice outdoor patio and pretty decent food. They have games on the patio and friendly staff. It's a nice place to bring people that tend to like American style food. The restaurant is a bit loud but many people come here for drinking and socializing so that's to be expected. It's trendy and modern on the inside and the restaurant is comfortable. I think they have live music on the weekends. Be aware they have mandatory valet parking for anyone who wants to park in the lot. It's free but make sure to have cash for a tip. You can park next door if you want to avoid valet. I think valet is only enforced during dinner hours.

9BJlDOdm9TDSUKB9IOqfag.text: Great place to grab burgers especially if you're visiting from out of town, we stopped here to grab a bite to eat after taking forever to make a decision and this place didn't disappoint. I will say I ordered sweet potato fries as my side and they seasoned them HEAVILY and I wish I'd known that prior to ordering. Other than that it's got a nice atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating although it's a little dark in there. I'd come back again if I'm visiting for sure though!

XNA7lJcZn3Ql92LIcosOrQ.text: Just had The Vig Manhattan and ordered the butterscotch bread pudding to go. The Manhattan is one of the best drinks I've had, and can't wait to try the bread pudding.  As far as service goes, everyone, especially Jenny the bartender, was very welcoming. Jenny had a pleasant disposition & went the extra mile for me and the rest of her guests.  The food was great, but the service will keep me coming back. Great job, Jenny!  P.S. The bread pudding was awesome!

l4qb0VOnJbk7w0LpYNQTHQ.text: I was told by a friend to come try the Pozole, so I definitely had to try it. I love trying foods to compare them to my grandma's cooking. I picked it up to go, but I love the vibe of the restaurant. I want to go back and hangout for a bit. The pozole order was huge compared to what I was expecting. All the fixings came on the side. I wish the fixings would've been packed individually only because I hate onion. The fixings were cabbage, red onion, cilantro, radish, avocado, & lime. The pozole was so good! So much flavor, not too spicy and the perfect ratio of hominy to pork. I never thought I would find good pozole, especially one you can order during the weekday! I can't wait to try out their other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Jqvyfto-5rMBtePhr_y8Ag.text: It's a Friday, at midnight. The Vig Uptown has 4 stars on Yelp.....HOW COME THERE'S NO ONE HERE??? Where is everyone? Why is it so quiet? I was very confused- it looks like a place where there should be a ton of people. But no, empty. Sad.

YPFafzBe6D-cog0niw-1iw.text: My Wife says best Mac n Cheese Ever! Everything was fresh, place was clean. Felt like I was in the best restaurant ever. places were very reasonable given the quality. Service was the only sub par thing here. And really the only thing preventing a five star rating. Server forgot to put in our "small" order of sweet potato fries, then brought them out as we were about done and still charged us for them. Great place, I'll chalk the server up to inexperience. Truth is everything else was so good, I didn't want to complain. Which I usually do. I'll be back, in a different section next time. Complimentary Valet as well

kzR_lgXblUe-hkBy_E8VKw.text: This is a really cool hang out spot - neat establishment and good vibes inside.

1nPmty1X6wWZsaRE6GzUWA.text: Where to begin? The staff is cold and uninviting.  Rolling eyes at the inconvenience of patrons trying to navigate past servers, searching various corridors trying to find the bathroom.  Design / architecturally is fine.  Very current.  The atmosphere at the bar was horrendous.  Vulgar.  Drunks.  If you are a twice divorced post-middle age slightly overweight dude.... this is your place.  Enjoy.

j76bLTrqhKqjTjJkoaS2UQ.text: I'm caught in the middle....I've been going to the Vintage Vig for a little bit now so when they opened up the Vig Uptown...I'm not gonna lie, it took me a few months before I checked it out......but I'm glad I did.  While I love the "old" Vig for it's awesome patio ( usually...not during the summer, of course) and great service, I love the new Vig for its decor, great drink specials, stellar service....and it's a little more geographically desirable.   The Arizona Room did trip me out at first because I assumed sitting up at the bar that it was a patio but it's actually nice being able to feel like you're SORT of outside without really being outside. The wall to leave your mark on is fun! It's an interesting little addition and it's entertaining to see what some people put up.   The guac and chips are good as are the sliders aka The Trifecta...can't go wrong with the shoe string fries. Once again, I'm going to have to head over there on an empty stomach to really test it out one of these days.  I can agree with most on the valet; the guys are really nice but there's tons of other spots to park at if you aren't super lazy and wanna cross the street (or head next door).  All in all, give the Vig a go.

LvvwPuzljQg2R3bMH6YAAA.text: Meh. Nothing special about The Vig. Certainly nothing there worth the wait. Kind of a pick up bar type place.  food is just ok. Again, not worth the wait. Friendly staff though.

sLLGuecCo6UuZzHX8wSe5Q.text: This is a tough review for me... as I am torn.... 3 starts? or 4 stars?   First I have to say I LOVE THE VIG!!! You should too. I am just not a super huge fan of this location.   Reasons:  1. It is further away from my house than the original Vig. *not anyone elses problem other than mine*  2. The patio is less than mediocer.  3. The place is made out of solid concrete, making everything echo and if there are more than 5 people in the building it is too loud to hear yourself even think, let alone talk to the people at your table.  4. I know most of the staff at the 40th street one, and I don't like change.  5. OH and Elvis Before Noon doesn't play here on Sundays.   Again, I LOVE THE VIG! The food is great the service is always good and a good time is usually had by all. But I have to say I am partial to the original. This is not to say you shouldn't go to the Vig Uptown, if you do it will be less crowded at the old one for me ;-)   Tips: Try the Vings, Smoked Salmon Ap, and the Tenderloin Salad (might not be on the menu but they can make it.)   Happy Vig-ing!

JR-xTAdYkyBDy-ShfbzSIA.text: Same great vibe as the original location.

3YZ3rzYDJIDhMCfMuRu0_A.text: Kick ass atmosphere, new fav place! Service is great, quick and delicious. Recommend the salmon or fish tacos! Pumpkin bread pudding!!

QZxYzagCSfPelOsvHZpwMA.text: Decided to check this place out for lunch yesterday. The decorations were very modern and I really liked the outdoor atrium you can eat in. I ordered a burger and wifey had the Hot chick sandwich. My burger was good, nothing to write home about but good. The wife enjoyed her sandwich, all though she overlooked the fact that the guacamole was spicy. I think this could be a great place to come and get some wine and appetizers, looking forward to coming back on the weekend! Late open kitchen is a bonus!

-U4V4xiFU9bUREesffxlNw.text: We are normally regular patrons of the Vig on 40th Street.  We tried this location out of curiosity.  The high quality was just like the other Vig. Delicious sandwich we shared.   All of the staff was super helpful and friendly.    This location is worth a trip just to appreciate the decor and design of the place.  Different vibe of the clientele at this location...not better or worse...just different.  Great job.

AbItV42AE-X4FYEmp0tmKA.text: YAY!!!!!!!!!!!  After months of anticipation, the new Vig location (closer to me vs. what is now affectionately referred to as "The Vintage Vig") is open and did not disappoint!  Whew!  The parking seems to still have some kinks to work out, as any signs of a valet stand or staff were MIA when I initially pulled up (7pm on a Sunday).  We figured it out though and no big deal.    The atmosphere here is just awesome, I absolutely love it.  It seems more spacious than the original space, but it was also slow while I was in there so I am hesitant to make a firm judgement until after it passes the Friday-happy-hour-test.  Same great vibe though, perhaps even warmer/sexier atmosphere.  The biggest surprise to me was the faux patio, with large open windows but actually an enclosed space.  For me, one of the fatal flaws of the original Vig patio the limited outdoor seats that also weren't smoking tables, so perhaps this is a good solve?  Overall, will absolutely put this spot in heavy rotation.  Keep the new locations coming, please!!

hEFC45nVaxwAd_4YYdxLdA.text: Went for the first time recently. Nice place. They don't take reservations and when we got there on a Friday night, the wait was about half an hour which wasn't too bad. Met up with some friends but wasn't too hungry so just got some chips and salsa and an apple martini. The waiter was very friendly and was good about checking on our table to see how our food was, refills, desserts, etc. The chips and salsa was pretty good and that was the 2nd best apple martini I've ever had. Good food, nice atmosphere, but nothing memorable.

q9bNhfiTmsIBr83TsMyugg.text: Okay, downgrading my last review.  One of the hallmarks of a great restaurant is its people (friendly conversationalists score the highest marks), consistency in food and general overall treatment.  Went there today to meet an old colleague of mine.  Ordered the mac and cheese as I thought that was good last time I had it (I must have had my places wrong, I think it must have been the Garage, across the street).  I think they changed the mac and cheese recipe.  IIf I liked it before, it tasted pretty plain and uninteresting this time around.  I had five bites and sent it back.  The waitress seemed perplexed, and went about her way.  Thereafter, I ordered the Chicken "Vings" which were pretty good, but not really amazing or anything to write home about.  While I was drinking my drink, I noticed there was a large crack in the glass and I told my waitress about it (yes, that is a serious safety risk).  She brings me back my drink filled up at about the 1/4 level (which was less than I even sent it back with).  If a place is that CHINTZY and feels that way about THEIR CRACKED GLASSES, then it is not the type of place I will go back to.  A classy place would have apologized for the inconvenience at the very least.  instead, they wanted me to feel stupid for raising the point. Later guys, I will take my business to the whining pig around the corner, or the the garage.  Good place, there is fun to be had, but customer service is everything especially with my routine 25% tips.  Someone else will appreciate it I am sure.  Friendly suggestion - throw a little more cheese in your mac and cheese, it won't hurt your profits that bad!!  Peace out.    Find your sizzle!!  Attorney Steve

1EXZSnErhtYALgDgklOtPQ.text: My picks:  Take Bethany Home Lil' Debbie (house infused vodka.... yum) The Trifecta Flatbread Pizza with Tandoori Chicken ( you had me with the paneer cheese)  I like the Vig Uptown.  It's not too busy yet and you can normally get a table without too much trouble.  It's a great meeting place and the happy hour menu is a steal.  The only con is they make you valet.  And I hate that, just on principle.

C8olM82EMXOS1IntTM2nAQ.text: Just tried the Vig Uptown for the first time.  We had a great time and are definitely going to keep this on our short list of restaurants to visit.  In more detail...  Amazing building!  The bocci ball court is definitely a hit with everyone and we were very impressed with the light and airy decor.  Knowing that this used to be a bank, you'd never expect that it would be so beautiful inside.  Food - the chicken kebobs were perfect.  I think the best flavors I've ever had in a kebob meal.  The Pad Thai is something that I was looking to try as well and it appears that the recipe is being fine-tuned to be just as good as the dish I had or better.  I know that parking is an issue for The Vig right now, but the valets are working their tails off to make it as transparent for the customer as possible.

HZ01b8j9LEfElp5TciA6Fg.text: I've been here a few times and I'm definitely a fan.  Great atmosphere, both inside or outside - a cozy, well-decorated spot with a good noise level for talking.  Everything I've tried has been really good - not super creative or anything, kind of just like upscale American bar food, but really well done and just the thing when I'm in the mood for that.  Decent beer selection and good drinks - I love the spicy margarita.  I will always be a repeat customer here for sure.

LjW_qP2CpankqHxVH66-iw.text: Stopped in for dinner last week.  They were out of the daily special, Sangria, so we settled on a half price bottle of wine.  We tried the asian short ribs for our appetizer, and had the carne asada potato for dinner.  The food was great!  The service was decent, but I think it suffered a bit as they were training a new employee.  We inquired as to the availability of bacon vodka.  They had none, but had experimented with some bacon flavored jim beam.  Which the bartender shared a bit of.   I like the new spot.  My girl and I will be back!

IbUiw8ZStI4gH8KFVzVrjQ.text: Pretty disappointing night.  Went out for a friend's birthday and landed at Vig Uptown for a change of pace. Started out ok with nice valet but then went downhill.  Slow to get service at our table.  Server brought wrong appetizer and did not offer to do anything about it until prompted.  Offered half off that item later (which did not actually happen on the bill!)  Ordered meal and it arrived correctly although no beverage refills were offered until a good way into the meal with empty glasses. We got about half way through our meal (which was so, so...) and finally the bocce court opened up so  we took the chance to play a game. We specifically asked the server to not clear our table while we played.  Well so much for that request.  The server took awhile all of our plates with the remaining food and drinks.  Nice, NOT!    Overall very disappointed in the sub-par food and the sloppy, way below par service.  Even though very close and convenient, not sure this will stay on my list of spots to frequent.

Q70hm58IFGzV0hJ0Y7nLEA.text: Love it and frequent this great neighborhood place.  Way better then the other location, unless you enjoy the rediculous Scottsdale / Arcadia crowd.  No hair plugs, Botox or fake rack needed to enjoy uptown.  Food is awesome, drinks are priced right and the service is always friendly and efficient!  Try the Vigan wrap.  Yummy.

3VHvx6dnIog2w9Rcyb0Pxw.text: Went there last night, picked the wrong food (artichoke kale dip) obviously it was expired....got sick from it all night.  :(

sWGyjDvEgpvaRNjvlhE71A.text: We always come to this location because we are always greeted with a smile and great service! Jazz in particular always brings our food and greets us with smile and makes sure we are well taken care of. She is awesome and such a light to everyone she encounters. Jazz you are such a bright light and a blessing to us. Keep on shining bright! You rock!

KCEPpFtXroKvrbMQKUPq4w.text: Again....here now....  10 mins to get chips and guacamole.   No drinks yet....friend is now at the bar to try and get their drinks.   Not quite sure whale service is such an issue. Sucks, cus the food is so good! Waitress is sweet too. Don't understand this.

VYYjjI9WdFAaaFUtVqVMyQ.text: I'm a big fan of the Vig, so it's no surprise that I was completely satisfied with their Uptown location. The food is good enough to win over the in-laws visiting from Germany, who aren't always easy to impress. We visited twice within a few weeks, and tried everything from the Pad Thai to the Vigazz burger to their famous Monday night $5 burger. The wait times can be a little long, but that's understandable with as popular as the Vig is. The setting is dim/semi-romantic yet surprisingly good for kids, with the indoor bocce ball green. The Vig remains on my list of best restaurants in the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Vigazz Burger.
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders.
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Vig&#39;s pad thai.

gDhUy2JG1DOb-qI4Ctvgag.text: This is really nicely designed place, with good (but not especailly awesome) food, and slightly spotty service.  It's tough to get a seat or find a parking space.    I've been here maybe 6 times and there is almost always a wait.    There's barely any parking, which means valet (cool area of town, I get it), but you can't really ask about the wait for a table before deciding whether or not to stay - the valet area is super tiny, so they take your car immediately.  When you go in and discover the wait is 45 mins to an hour, you're already trapped.  There's a cool patio area with incredibly uncomfortable bench-couch-type seating in the back - if you're going to have a wait, it ought to be comfy.  The menu is definitely decent, but not spectacular, in both options and execution.  I feel like the quality/creativity of the food isn't good enough to make up for all the trouble.  The Vigan sandwich, Pad Thai and fish tacos are all tasty, but nothing will knock your socks off.    Additionally, I've had semi-rude service at least twice, and I'm far from picky or demanding.    Overall, it's a perfectly good place to stop into when it's quiet and you're in the neighborhood, but not worth a special trip or an hour wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deconstructed fish tacos: nice piece of fish over light and flavorful slaw (with corn!), plus fixins.
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute bar on the enclosed patio.

qll8RNpQjtg8wM2FCZ9yCg.text: I decided to try The Vig after reading all of the awesome Yelp reviews about it. So the place is really cool. It's pretty spacious with a covered patio-like area that would be great to sit in on a sunny day. The place only had about 4 customers when I went in...so it was pretty empty and we were prompted to seat ourselves.  Me and my boyfriend ordered the cheese tots, onion rings, fish tacos and the VigAzz Burger with sweet potato fries. The tots,  they were eh...if you ate 2 or more, you would get full quick, as well as the onion rings...very heavy food. The fish tacos were great! Blackened white fish=YUM. Although there were too many onions, my bf enjoyed the VigAzz sandwich, it was huge! All in all, the service was ok and the food was ok. I would definitely give it another try to taste some other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Art hanging on the ceilings, pretty damn cool.
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The VigAzz burger!

LVfCIQNl-2QFsgekQbhwLw.text: Unfortunately, I have to give this place just one star due to the poor attitude of the valet.  The valet is the first impression you get when you reach a restaurant and if they aren't professional, it really makes you think twice about walking in to dine at the establishment. I did not realize I wasn't able to self park at ALL when I pulled up to this location.  I saw the valet sign, but did not want to valet and assumed I could self park. After self-parking, we were more or less "given the business" from the parking attendant.  I advised him I wanted to self-park and purposely didn't valet as I didn't have any cash to tip and I'm not typically a person that likes to valet my car.  They had plenty of open parking spots as it was lunchtime.  So, he walked away and didn't argue about. Upon getting closer to the entrance, a different valet parking attendant gave me a hard time about "not stopping and driving right through".  I advised him it was a mistake and I didn't realize I couldn't self park.   Another woman self parked her car and advised she'd been there since 10 a.m.  She was out getting something from her car and noticed the way the guy was giving me attitude.  She then went in and spoke to the manager about their attitude, especially the 2nd guy.  I walked over as she was talking to the manager and gave her my side of the story as well.  The manager was apologetic and kind about the situation.   After our meal, I went to the restroom and saw the same lady in the bathroom.  She advised that the manager comped her meal and asked if she did the same for me.  I, with shock, told her "no".  I never got a comped meal, discount or anything of the kind.  Interesting, since I was the one that was spoken to unprofessionally by the valet as I walked into the restaurant. When I got out to my car, I noticed plenty of open parking spots still, but yet a HUGE construction work truck that they decided to park right next to my car as "payback".  I can only assume payback because of there being plenty of other spots open.  Pretty immature and again, speaks to the unprofessional demeanor of the valet attendants.    Food was good, but the valet experience was terrible.  It's unfortunate they have no self-parking (even at a slow weekday lunch) and that the valet had to treat customers the way that they did.

AOL2ntVeL7WKEKc4qU58zA.text: Im going to make this short and simple..... This place was nott bad but definitely nothing special. Service was great. Salmon was bland and overcooked, coleslaw was also very bland. My sangria was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled salmon

Dn5p_tVbKGsT9NnZBaR-YQ.text: Salmon, pad Thai, edamame, Mac & cheese, I just found this review as a draft. Truthfully I have been to so many goddamn places I don't remember half of them!  In fact, that's why I started Yelping so I can remember a place to eat when someone says "where should we go?"   Wait, as I imbibe a Fat Head Up In Smoke Porter in Pittsburgh, at one of the best and coolest restaurants I have been to since Yelping, I'm recollecting The Vig.  AZ during my Grand Canyon-Sedona trip in November.  Yes, this place was a very cool design and ambiance. Food was eclectic and very good. And the AZ Cardinals were playing and winning on their tv. That's all I got.  Next time I must remember to post then and there.   Oh, and when in Pittsburgh, you must visit Mad Mex.  See my timely ;) review.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bocce court
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Photo bomb.

8q_YOH_DRZkPELX3HhvTSQ.text: The atmosphere is really chill and big. They have corn hole on the side, and there is a huge couch group seating area. I got the greek salad and it was amazing! The salad is fresh and the chicken is not dry. Their artichoke dip is also really good! The waitress was super nice, clean place, really would recommend. It was moderately priced which was nice because the place looks very upscale :)

D0wgPK698roNx-PTHsuwMw.text: I stopped by here visiting from out of town and am so glad I did. It was Saturday late morning and they have a $4 build your own Bloody Mary bar. Best idea ever. I ordered the pozole, it's GF and so yummy! Would definitely order again. 4 stars because two waitresses were fighting over our table in front of us and it was a bit awkward.

xzsLVccIBn_1s4v9wom9jw.text: Went on a Saturday for lunch.  Arrived and parked on site- thank you Vig!  Really neat, old building.  Beautiful stained glass window by the front door.  Employees were all very polite and attentive.  Well done Vig!  Food time - mac and cheese, get it.  Wonderful!  I had the Hangover Helper - it was really really good.  Large portion too.  Sauce was the right kind of spicy.  Only beef?  Seating - we wanted to sit "out back" and could see several available tables.  We wound up waiting about 20 minutes to be seated when they had outdoor seating capacity.

OE48RmBhufC2bcMBVm8KQw.text: Came for brunch on a Saturday when they opened at ten. Very nice patio with a good breeze when we were there in mid-March for spring training. We sat in the lounge area and had great service. The guacamole was fantastic. So few places can make it well. It was definitely freshly made and seasoned perfectly. I also had a bowl of the posole. Excellent flavor served hot. The pork was well seasoned and the hominy was cooked perfectly.

HeDHJPV_wslZtMJD5wkVgw.text: We visited the Vig Uptown today for lunch. What an awesome atmosphere!! We didn't need to worry about parking because they have complimentary valet. Those guys deserve 5 stars too! Service was perfect and our food was outstanding! We tried the Hangover Helper and the Asian chopped salad along with a few sides. To add to the atmosphere, they had the best live music today. I need to find out who he was. A great spot to check out especially on a beautiful Sunday!

74r5YJa4ajcxA2EOdAn3Pw.text: This was my first visit to the Vig Uptown.  I loved it!  The place, lighting, and food - all excellent!!  My brother and I took our mom out for a lunch and shopping outing.    All three of us got burgers.  Pretzel bun please....  Loved it.    Almost a 5 star, but the server was just not happy to be there.  He did not say hello, just took drink orders, and left.  Came back and took food order and left.  Checked on us once during our time there.  Had to flag him down for refills twice.  He dropped off the check without a word.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arcadia burger

8ss2frs5XAaBp9yilVn9aA.text: My favorite vig location! Always great service and staff they already recognize us sometimes we go so much. I love that the food is always consistently good you know what you order will not disappoint. Great ambiance I love the seating outside just all around it's a favorite spot to grab some dinner and drinks oh and you can't forget the brunch! Great brunch!

zPDf9P3x5XxUKC9U9wgKsA.text: This place has managed to stay on my 5 star list since November 2011 ( when I was first introduced to the Vig compliments of Yelper David L) I have had 2 yelp accounts since that first delicious burger, and many more burgers before I went back to being vegan. I saved all my reviews  & this was my last update ..when I was still a Carnivore. And burger pics from my first visit in 2011.  6/19/2012 I fell in love the ambiance here (back in the fall) it is just a very cool place that happens to be trendy,  and comfy all at the same time. Nice place for a few drinks, or dinner followed by cocktails.   The Monday  5 dollar burger deal paired up with a Stella beer in my opinion just cannot be beat . the Vig burger is gigantic,  and juicy  topped with bacon, gouda,  and red onion. The arcadia burger is a classic cheeseburger with a yummy sauce . Pair these up with crispy sweet potato fries,  and an ice cold Stella,  and it is all good . And,  i really like the service they all have great personalities and that is a plus in my book .  I also dig their Nacho's, and they have 5 dollar drinks on Wednesdays .And a cool reverse HH as well on Thursday   The Vig Rocks ! .  Update April 2013  I loved the tofu scramble which was chock full of onions, peppers, mushrooms wrapped burrito style, it was delicious, and filling. Bloody Mary's hit the spot as well.  Still a 5  it's nice to have Vegan options- but.. I still love this place for drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing burger plate

g5_pcFrHXakMgiGo72gNXQ.text: Bummed over Brunch - won't be back.   To start, I have been a big fan of The Vig since I moved to Phoenix 6 years ago. Taken first dates there, spent a few birthdays, dinner with friends and many terrific brunches. Lately, we have become more choosy about where we spend our time and money, so when we had the craving for mimosas and a good brunch, we debated between a familiar favorite, The Vig, or a recent new interest, St. Francis. We had not been to The Vig in awhile and decided, Uptown it was. We wanted bottomless mimosas, ceviche to start, and then a yummy breakfast dish.   We got there a bit before Noon to find it about half full not too crazy, waited at the door for the hostess to figure out what she was doing (not kidding) and finally sat a party of five ladies before us, then us, then another couple of guys after us, all sitting pretty close in vicinity. Ladies had a server approach first, then the other guys, then us, whatever. We asked for the starters only to learn that it was now illegal to serve bottomless mimosas (boo, oh well) and that they had taken the ceviche off the menu. Whaaat?! BOTH are still on the website menu guys. Fine, we ordered mimosas and chips and guac. Mimosas came and then placed our food order and waited for the appetizer. We ended up waiting 20 minutes for the chips and guac after having to remind our server Lindsey ("oh, yeah...") about them and watching the other 2 tables who ordered the same thing get theirs shortly after ordering. Our server returned (and said "oh, they must have lost the ticket" with little empathy for their mistake. Thankssssss.  All the while, waiting for our app, we start to look around and take in the environment. I have to say, this was the strangest visit I have ever had to Uptown. We saw they had some sort of Fantasy Football league party of people on the patio, who didn't seem to be taking much of the server's attention. It wasn't a huge group, so it didn't seem to be a reason for the speed of service. Also, we noticed there was no music on, not sure if they turned it off or extremely low for the party, but geez, it was so stale and sleepy in there. It felt like you were dining in a place after-hours when they want you to leave.   After about 3 minutes of eating the chips, our food arrives. UGH. Hate that. This is why we ordered them early, not a new concept here but anyway. Server becomes back 30 seconds later and asks how the entrees are, and we tell her we haven't touched them yet as we were still wanting to enjoy the appetizer. She says, "Oh, don't stress about the chips and guac, I took it off your bill." Yeah, that's nice of you but seriously "don't stress"??? Yeah, stressed isn't quite the feeling I am experiencing right now.   He orders the Eggs Benedict (neither of us had tried it before) and I ordered the Steak & Eggs (same deal, first time).   Eggs Benedict - nothing to expand upon. Pretty basic. The Hollandaise is a spicy version and not exactly the star of the dish. Then again, there were no stars, the fact that english muffins, ham and eggs taste good together is the only thing that made the dish enjoyable.   Steak and Eggs - Sent it right back (see photo). Steak was gray. Hash browns were hash-grays. Everything just looked soggy and unappetizing. I ordered the steak medium, which is essentially was, but this flank steak was the worst looking piece of steak I have ever had put in front of me. I cut it up and the texture was all gristle and mush, took one bite and it was my last. No flavor, chewy, gross. The hash browns were one big soggy grey pancake. I am not eating this. Signaled the server and told her and she offered to have it remade - no thanks, i will just take the Eggs Benedict, I am over this brunch.   The reorder takes (of course) longer than the original order and in the meantime, it felt like the waitress is now staying away from our table. All the while, I was never rude or mean in my tone with her and you would think with as many issues as our table had been experiencing, there would have been some added attention to at least save the tip right? Keep the mimosas coming? Nope! Lindsey failed. We had to ask others who came by, one who may have been a manager and I ended up explaining that we had to send the food back, since she noticed I didn't have a plate. She then said that she agreed about the quality of the steak, it's not good, and that their "hash browns" are more like a potato pancake. But gray? Ummm, so the issue is known that the $14 Steak and Eggs aren't good and more than just myself have had an issue, yet, still on the menu.  This was the worst experience I have had at the Vig, and upon trying the Fillmore location we have had TWO pretty crappy service experiences (so we don't go anymore). Arcadia has always been the best. As of now, I wouldn't dare try Scottsdale.   I am hoping this isn't a sign of things going downhill because they have too many locations to manage.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Oh, we took the ceviche off the menu. Yeah, it&#39;s been like 6 months now!&#34; Well, it&#39;s still on the menu on your website!
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Oh, we don&#39;t do bottomless mimosas anymore, they are illegal in Arizona.&#34; So, remove them from your website&#39;s menu then...?

Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $14 Steak and Eggs with Hash browns - &#34;50 Shades of Gray&#34; on a plate - sent it back! It&#39;s a bad flank steak with a soggy potato pancake.

QuSS0JyCu7EWSUiAdqAEmA.text: First time eating at The Vig Uptown! Delicious food - good service, and a great place to gather with family and small children!

uUIDn1aWXLPzYCCT0XKfQQ.text: XLNT. Good food..surprisingly awesome posole (for reals...try it)...good drinks..attentive staff..all three locations know what they are doing. Great vibe...I come here often..sometimes I try and mix up to new locations..but honestly.. these guys rock! Great all around..good place to bring anyone.

EnkjuDQMNi5msx_JOiz8Tg.text: Upscale, mid century modern, hipster ambience. Great for a date. Sit by the firepit. You can even play corn hole!   Good selection of booze. We asked for an obscure single malt scotch and our waitress knew all about the selections.  Decent food. Modern iterations of bar fare. Good fries.  UPDATE: 08/19 I had a GREAT time at The Vig Uptown hosting my son's birthday party. The staff was SO MUCH FUN in helping to embarrass my boy. We ordered the mac n cheese (a hit!), the wings (just ok), big basket of fries (we had to order these twice!), the nachos (awesome!).

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Vig&#39;s staff were SO MUCH FUN in helping my son w his birthday.
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Vig&#39;s staff were SO MUCH FUN in helping my son w his birthday.

nJ8W9RV7kvTeTZarBOjNrQ.text: I have been here more than a handful of times and always have had a consistently good experience.  I typically stick to happy hour here and there is a wide selection of app to choose from.  I thought the blacked fish tacos were good but the wings were better this past trip.  I would get both again though.  The flatbread pizza was the winner for the night at our table.   They could use more IPAs on tap but that is more of a personal preference.  The tower station IPA they have is good but I always like a different IPA to try for my second beer.

AyM21JbQdya2v1Qw5V3ozw.text: One of my top local chains in the valley. McDowell Mountain / 16st (this location) are my go-tos.   Thai wings is a favorite here. The sweet/spicy glaze and natural size of drums/thighs is why I order them. If you are not a fan of oversized looking wings, you are going to love these wings.  Sweet potato fries are my side for the wings. Crispy and well seasoned.  Rear patio is covered but does have oversized windows that twist open. Patio seating has enough tables to sit couples to large groups.  Sitting at the east side of the restaurant (rear patio) has a private area for bocci ball and bags.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bags

CZCv8sh8OaVEPOS-tOy65A.text: We started off with the Charcuterie Board which had a, "handpicked selection of meats, cheese, fruits, nuts, crostini" ($17). There was brie, almonds, strawberries, grapes, prosciutto, and more.  Then we had the Classic Burger, "lettuce, tomato, onion, american cheese, secret sauce, brioche bun" ($13) and the Crispy Chicken sandwich "buttermilk fried chicken, american cheese, jalapenos, pickles, and smoked honey mustard on ciabatta" ($14). They were both okay but nothing spectacular.   We finished off with the Gingerbread Cake, "pumpkin mousse, pecan crumble, sugared cranberries, molasses caramel" ($10). Again nothing mind blowing but it was decent.  Everything food wise was missing that punch. I have a feeling most of the grand reviews are about their brunch, not dinner.   However, although the food was nothing incredible the ambiance and service was. As the sun set the light flooded in filtered by the stained glass windows which was lovely, my friend managed to catch it in a photo. During that hour, the place lit up beautifully. Also, there is architecturally a lot of texture throughout which added to the creative atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Gingerbread Cake ($10).
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Charcuterie Board ($17).
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside.

w_C33Woaorz80A9tzEh3Rg.text: Our server Ben was extremely knowledgeable, enthusiastic, he went above and beyond for me and my party and provided excellent service, on top of that was fun and friendly. He told us all about the chefs special and daily mule, he gave excellent suggestions and even helped me pair a cocktail with my main entree.

s4w9hjhjVxjifX1FtNlGZQ.text: Sunday evening around 530pm is perfect timing to grab a bite to eat. The music is chill indie vibes and the crowd is low key. Perfect for dinner with your kiddo.   I had the black bean burger with a side of sweet potato fries. The burger had a nice spice and great texture.   My daughter had the chicken fingers and shoe string fires. She loved the meal but wished the fries were thicker.   We had a root beer and an Arnold Palmer to wash it all down. Both were refreshing and just what we needed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waiting for our table!
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black bean burger and sweet potato fries...soooo flavorful!
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids chicken fingers and shoe string fries.

lptzYI7WElb6m6tBwmL9aA.text: We love the Vig, never been to the Uptown location so we decided to stop here before the M3Fest on Saturday. Switched it up and ate at the bar and the bartender was super helpful and nice, forgot her name but she worked there Saturday around 2:30pm.  You have to try the SHORT RIB MELT!! To die for!  Red wine braised short ribs, caramelized red onion, white cheddar, toasted sourdough for $14 and it's worth every penny! The flavors are spectacular.  Would for SURE visit this location again, awesome energy and vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib sandwich with a side of onion rings, SO DELICIOUS!

RzLeVd12wo1PlipcQr3lzg.text: We make a point of visiting The Vig every year during Spring Training. The indoor-outdoor seating is perfect for the glorious Arizona winter/spring.   The food is always top notch. The drinks are quick. Mosts importantly it's an easy place to lose time relaxing with friends.

5YDI3bqHMluIbEfzJhSGlA.text: Oh the Vig, what Phoenetian has not been to the Vig? If you're reading this and the answer is "I haven't been to The Vig!" then step away from the computer, enter your vehicle; be it sneakers, sandals, or moon shoes, and get to the Vig. You'll especially want to follow these simple directions if it's the weekend during brunch hours or Mondays for their $5 burgers after 6pm, weekdays between 3-6pm for happy hour, or just about any other time.  The weekend brunch and those Bloody Mary's, the Bloody Mary bar; for me, please hold the bloody and bring only the Mary. For those of us, I know there's more than just me out there, who don't particularly enjoy the tomato juice, this is a build it yourself sort of Bloody Mary bar. For a cool $4 they'll bring you a glass of Titos vodka on ice and send you on your way to the Bloody Mary bar. Top yours with things like bacon, asparagus, meat balls, celery, and a host of other ingredients, it's almost a meal to itself; but for my Bloody Mary, and again, hold the bloody, I'll take just a few of those limes please!  Ahh the chorizo burro, the dish I just can't stop ordering, and just for fun, I deconstruct it by asking for the tortilla on the side. I'd like to tell you that I don't finish that tortilla, every time, though that's always my intention. I'd also like to tell you the sky is green and it's always cold in Phoenix Arizona. I'd like to say a lot of things but they just wouldn't be True, and you, my friends, deserve nothing but the truth. It's always delicious, it's always satisfying, and they've always got cool music playing during Sunday brunch.  So go and get it Phoenix weekend brunchers. If you're still debating on partaking in their delightful weekend meals, I say, why wait?, carpe diem, eat brunch!  Happy yelping!

Fm8nYfUPP1PIS_nVfe8izw.text: I'd heard of the Vig, but I rarely go to downtown Phoenix, so I didn't pay much attention. So one day I'm driving along Bethany Home Rd and I see a sign for The Vig - what! I thought it was downtown?! (Yelps it) There's more than one! BRILLIANT!  We went for a weekday lunch in the winter, sat on the beautiful back patio, tables and lounge-type seating, with huge windows letting the sun nourish indoor plants and brighten a bocce ball court.   Each thing we ordered was an ideal version of that thing. Moscow Mule - in a Tito's copper mug with a lime, delicious. A couple of apps - fried calimari with a banging sauce and a grilled lemon, and jalepeno artichoke dip with pita, so gooey and good.   Entrees: corn and avocado salad, crispy and delicious and great ingredient ratio, and killer Korean short rib tacos with fried onions and salsa - FOUR tacos by the way, one up from the typical taco entree amount of three, a great move.  Great meal, cool waiter, comfy space, well-executed comfort food dishes that are just a notch above and one idea better than what you'd normally get. The Vig!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dip as served
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Korean tacos
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad

7v3eHXWDL1kE14h_wTUs0A.text: Everything I've ever tried here is yummy! The hummus, salads, and especially the guacamole! I also like how laid back this spot is and the extra step they take to add the games in. This is a great place to go to on a date and also a great place for Happy Hour. I think it is also the perfect place to go to with friends for an evening hangout.

SoeiBJf7_wSNvGCCm6qzXA.text: I've been here often and typically get the same thing but decided to switch it up a bit. I came here to kill time while the Fiesta Bowl parade had my neighbourhood blocked in.  There's a great option of mimosas so I had the grapefruit mimosa and it was so refreshing I probably chugged them too fast. For brunch I had the avocado toast, which I typically like, but they make it a bit different here. I was expecting the toast to be more like toast or somewhat toasted, but the bread was thick and soft kind of like French toast. The dressing from the bed of arugula topping the bread probably made it soggier than I prefer. It still had a great flavour, I didn't eat the bread but ate everything else like a salad.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OLmu7CkAwNca4PX4NEE7tQ.text: I am a big fan of The Vig locations, but this might just be my favorite. There's lawn dice, cornhole, and bocci available in the back. It's enclosed which is nice in the summer to cool off and hang out.   Ambiance is on par for the brand, very cool and chill vibe. I like the decor. It's a place where you can actually enjoy and doesn't make you want to leave as soon as you're done eating.   Drink selection is good, they have some awesome signature cocktails and great beer selection. The menu has a nice variety and has something for everyone.   On this particular visit where were six of us. I love the slider trifecta (that pretzel bun tho) and their tacos (both fish and short rib) but I decided to go with the poke bowl this time. Others at the table ordered the Mac n cheese, Pad Thai and Cobb salad and all enjoyed their dishes.   The poke bowl comes with tuna and lots of veggies/lettuce. I had a more salad vibe than poke bowl but it was delicious. Light and flavorful. I'd recommend if you don't want something so heavy but don't want a basic salad.   Our waitress was super nice and chill. Didn't make us feel rushed but checked in often. Bathrooms were nice and clean. Valet parking available during dinner time, make sure to have some cash to tip. Just another great meal! I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back &#34;patio&#34; area
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back &#34;patio&#34; cornhole area
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poke bowl

cqxZzu2Z8Rf4xeRCBR3OPw.text: I was super bummed to learn that this location doesn't serve brunch!! After all the times I've had brunch at other locations i didn't know each one had their own menu. We had "lunch" here on New Year's Day and everything was pleasant. Our server was very nice. I ordered chicken nachos and my boyfriend ordered the big bowl of pozole YUM!  Anyway.. other than the no brunch menu(no eggs, like at all) it was pretty good/ Vig standard. The patio was beautiful and clean cut and everything was nice and neat. I will definitely be returning to this Vig... for dinner or happy hour but not brunch lol.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice clean cut patio
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Water ;)
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pozole yum

RQ5OxVYmzDIJYEpNmypoqA.text: We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon. The ambiance was cool, though with the musician on the patio, it was a bit loud. But it was good music, so who can complain? The patio area has couches and a nice outdoor vibe but it's air-conditioned. Genius! I had the Vig Burger and it was a perfect balance of flavors - so good! My husband had sliders and onion rings which were delicious. The table next to us had a fresh cinnamon roll in a cast iron skillet that gave us order envy, so we'll soon be back to try that.

2kOG53lPmjQ2CrBF58EwJA.text: Ok I've been back a couple times since my bad experience. It's good.   It seems they've really focused on staff training and service is top priority again.   I love their food. The salmon, the pazole, the short rib tacos, the Mac and cheese. All soooo good.   Glad we can be regulars again. Check out their summer week night specials

260Q5BJBILEB4zWbUNjPBg.text: WOW!! My wife and I stopped in for the 1st time. All I can say is the food and service was amazing! We ordered Nachos with Carnitas, wings, posole, and a classic burger with onion rings! Everything came out hot flavorful and spot on!! Definitely coming back and bringing friends

CH15IaFp72pO4phspvOLjA.text: Met my cousin for lunch at 1:30 which was perfectly timed after the rush.  We shared the charcuterie board and we had salads.  I,  the cobb and my cousin had the Greek, They were both delish!  The parking is tricky if you go during a busy time but there is another lot on the same side 300 ft north and if you are lucky across the street may have open spots.  Valet only during dinner.  We spent 3 hrs there visiting (she was from out of town) and the service was awesome. Our waiter was patient & polite yet attentive to our needs.  Doesn't get any better than that!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome Charcuterie!

UovcjKCkV3Q8FUGg8PYDBQ.text: Oh their Pozole are to die for, they come out in a Giant bowl!!! I was sick and craved for it & it cleared my sickness right away!

nzkw7c0_-1547HfbqIpcXw.text: I love this place. I've been many times and always have had a great experience. It's closer to work than home so I usually go for more work related reasons and have hosted a number of group events there as well. They do a great job and are very accommodating to your groups needs. If you do an event and use their catering menu order TWICE the number of sliders you think you will need. They are that good. And the corn hole court is a great activity for group events as well. Anyhow, I digress - this review is about our experience on Sat for brunch/lunch.   We were running errands and found ourselves near this Vig location and decided to stop in for a bite to eat. They were offering both a brunch and their regular lunch menu. And $3 mimosas!  WOOT!    I ordered off the brunch menu - chicken enchiladas with over easy eggs. They were amazing. The eggs were cooked perfectly so the yolk ran out into the sauce when you cut into them. And the sauce - a green chili sauce - was to die for. Just the right amount of tang and heat. I asked for the cream and pico on the side and didn't use much of either but I managed to clean my plate otherwise.   Hubby ordered off the lunch menu and got the standard Vig burger with fries. He loves his burgers medium rare and it's not always cooked perfectly but it was. Just the right amount of toppings and cheese  and their fries are amazing - thin and crispy on the outside but soft inside. I must admit I stole a few to soak up the green chili sauce from my enchiladas.   It's a great, solid restaurant with a great, laid back atmosphere. You won't regret stopping in for a bite and a beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn hole and bocci ball court

1_5ECkYTmdyk1sGYXnUyEQ.text: 1) So happy there is a Vig close to my work and my home. 2) "Vintage" Vig has a beautiful patio, and Uptown Vig has a concrete room with big windows, which they cant open at night because the surrounding neighborhood. First i did not like this. But now that its 95 outside,at 9 at night, I'm loving it! 3) Still have the bocce ball court. 4) Same good food and drink. Over all, I have been plenty of times, had great nights, and don't plan on stopping anytime soon. I'm so happy there is an Uptown Vig now. See ya there!

Z3xckKtM_WGWcOUbPVvGwg.text: I still don't get it. Even DJ Sean Watson can't save this place, and that says A LOT.

8mTTfp2rn-CEt8J9kbc_pg.text: Went on a week night with a party of four.  It had a nice atmosphere and full of energy!  The food was good and especially the sweet potato fries.  The service was also very nice.  I would definitely go again later.

_7qJjie0rBuktdWjfGoVeQ.text: I had the most pleasant time here on Father's Day. I've been to The Vig plenty of times, but never on a Sunday during lunch and never the one Uptown. The food is always fabulous, and all Fathers got a free lunch on Father's Day! But the icing on the cake? The DJ. I love trip hop and it's really rare for a DJ these days to spin chill music like that. Not only that, but he had a live trumpet player keeping in time. He even busted out the bass. The fact that my Dad is a killer trumpet player and the fact that the DJ was spinning Mushroom Jazz (Mark Farina) seriously made my day. I could barely hold a conversation because I was grooving to the smoove tunes so much. Wrote about it on Facebook and got at least 3 people to check it out simply because I was raving about the chill vibe. And if you don't know what Mushroom Jazz is, you should.

l_NgUSGzbNP0RJW3Vh5t3g.text: Great happy hour prices and man how I love me some Pork Canitas tacos

gKyaafXMtpnKyBzEdcl3wg.text: I live just down the street, so I finally went here with a friend a few weeks ago.  The ambiance is nice and it seems like a fun place to hang out and have a drink.  The food on the other hand, was pretty blah.  We shared a french dip sandwich and some chips and guacamole.  Both were of similar quality to food that you would find at any chain restaurant.  I was not impressed at all.    I would definitely go back for a drink, but will refrain from eating there again.

JGYsTTR4JHDE0B3P5b2k_A.text: I live much closer to The Arcadia Vig, but met up with a friend at The Vig Uptown this morning for brunch. The decor at Uptown is amazing... the windows alone had me drooling. I had to wipe up the drool to partake of my delicious breakfast: The Hangover Helper with the $3 Vigazz Bloody Mary. The bloody mary wasn't the best I'd ever had (even though it was rated high in Best of Phoenix) but the Hangover Helper was possibly the best brunch item that I have ever tasted. Worth it for that alone.

OCL1dRBGnVRHs2yCTGeAqA.text: I am heartbroken. I've been here on four previous occasions and every time the food has been impeccable and delicious. Had I reviewed The Vig Uptown on one of those prior outings, I would have easily given it four or five stars. The atmosphere is funky but classy and the staff are all nice and welcoming and attentive. This time, sadly, the food did not measure up. I had the carne asada on a potato pancake and while the flavors were spot on, the steak was so overcooked it was like more like jerky than steak. My boyfriend's french fries were both cold and stale.
