Definately a great place to bring a date or grab some drinks with friends, not so much not family friendly but just catered towards 20-40 year old crowds.  Will definitely be coming back when in the area again, until then I can only dream about the Vigazz...sigh.

1il17SMMLwmk1-PmlwrQug.text: I like it!  The bartenders and staff are super nice and the atmosphere is very chill. Loved the gin and earl grey martini and the posole is very tasty if you're a menudo fan. Great place to hangout on a laid back weekend night.

AW91sWVZ00S-7TBuRqucPw.text: I really like the ambience of this place. Electronic lounge music made it a very comfortable atmosphere and the delicious food was something to come back for. I love the service I got. Famished from a hike I drank 3 waters and my 3 lemonades quickly. They even preempted my next glass at one point, which made me very happy. I received a little box for my tiny portion of a Trifecta sliders which were on point with a well-buttered pretzel bun. The season fries were spicy and that's how I like it. I hope to come back and enjoy some DUCE BAG/ CORN HOLE on my next visit. This is a great place for small to large groups and will be in my wanting memory for times to come. :D

jJk7ydkWM6O8zXE1xs8o9Q.text: Food is good. Service is absolutely wretched and the staff have poor manners. Would not recommend this location. For better and kinder service, try the Filmore Vig.

8Twgktf8WJd5VWNqPx4j8g.text: This place is Hipster central but that is not necessarily a bad thing. I had the daily fish which was the sea bass and it was delicious!!! The reuben is also very delicious. On Sunday's they have half off bottles of wine. We ordered a nice bottle of white pinot and complimented the fish very well. The folks split a reuben sandwich and it was phenomenal. We have a high standard when it comes to deli meat and, believe me, this sandwich was on point. The corned beef was still dripping its own juices and garnered bits of fat that accentuated the entire flavor of the sandwich.  All in all, very good. Might have to come back to The Vig for happy hour.

VIB9kYw6gxBn9UR52hAYeA.text: A generous three stars for this hipster hangout. The posole had potential but it hindered by a garden serving of cold cabbage bring it to room temperature.  The oh so catchy named "Vings" were overcooked and dry served with frothy milk ranch and out of a bottle sweet chili sauce. The soy garlic edamame was pretty good, great combo of soy and spicy.  The building architectural features and decor are very nice and set the stage of expectations high, but unfortunately it just didn't pan out tonight.

5AIdI_goA6_flbZEJudguQ.text: Eh - semi trendy place trying too hard to be trendy. food is just meh, alright. Been on several occasions and staff always seem to be too bust to refill or check in on table. Food wasnt bad, but eh, there are better options.

zyNkrqAqzs40fBmi8ftK6g.text: Wow! What else can I say? We had an outstanding dining experience last Saturday night! The staff was friendly and attentive the entire evening and the food was outstanding to say the least.   I had called a few hours before to get directions and also find out what type of wait we were to expect on a Saturday night for 4...they said it would be bout 15-20 minutes.  We showed up and and we're seated within 5 min even though it was busy!  Great vibe and great scenery... If you get my drift. :)  Megan, you are awesome!  Can't wait for cooler weather so we can try out the patio which looked amazing.  We will definitely be back with even more friends soon!!

UC2PUd7volPQl_xma-tRGQ.text: A favorite haunt.  Close to my office, free valet, good food and drink.  This place does usually have great scenery too.  Win.

hv5Sy3XUgB8bO7HJwZA8Og.text: Trying the Turkey Sand rage!    Seven stars for the Turkey Sandwich.  One star for the staff.  I hate writing bad reviews but where on earth are restaurants hiring their staff from lately?  Our waitress was the WORST...inattentive, sloppy in appearance, slow to respond and truly uninterested in her job.

HOVdz74RTWjp2k0esg83Dg.text: This past weekend I went to The Vig Uptown twice because it was that  good. This is a perfect place to hangout with friends and get a bite to eat with a really great drink menu. What I love most about this place is that it is very modern and the people are pretty chill. The cherry on top is the games they have to offer, Bocce and Bags!  Drinks 1. Moscow Mule is a perfect nice refreshing drink to order, made with Vodka/Ginger beer and fresh lime juice.  2. If you bring in your own "pimp cup" any size, They will fill it up with the mixed drink called Pimms Cup.  Food 1. VigAzz burger is my favorite food item to order because the pretzel bread is amazing. 2. Thai spicy Vings here are probably one of my favorite wings that i've ever had so I highly recommend getting them.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot Chick

yPAD3_260kuzgLArSTQyzg.text: Sorry for the late update.  I was contacted right away from the owner apologizing and sent us a gift certificate to come back.  I really hated giving the bad review before because I have always had good experiences there.  I changed my last review to 3 stars and will give the update 5.  The owner is genuinely concerned about his customers and quality of service at his establishments.

q9TTDEwKXKswhSyML-usog.text: Had a Great Blackened chicken BLT. Great Flavor and Nice portion not to much. Atmosphere is calm and relaxing Great place to have Vodka Tonic and a great meal!

odIT14wrYZhD-HzWNRjcbQ.text: The Vig is so much fun!! It's a great place to bring friends or a date. With good beer on tap, strong cocktails, and delicious menu selections, you really can't go wrong. And what's not to love about a place that has bags set up in the back? The vibe is casual yet trendy, and the crowd is very chill. The service is shotty, but I think it has to do with how busy it gets.  Overall, if you get the chance, hit up The Vig (either one!!) for a good time.

08c37gHn_0TpMYBJifkyCg.text: The 40th St location is superior in service. This is the 3rd time here and the service is absolutely horrible. Ten min for two waters and still have to track someone down for a cocktail especially when the place is dead. They Need some management here.

FrXh3prcUiCXnSrMHKQkaA.text: They have the best Fish Tacos I have ever eaten, and I am a huge Fish Taco fan. I am always on the hunt for them, and this is the place folks.

JcdqfOLWF16F8arksLJJ5Q.text: Before tonight, I had only been to the Vig Filmore which is newer but I have to say that my best experience was here at the Vig Uptown. I came here with 2 boys to watch the college championship football game and I have to say this was the perfect place to do so. The restaurant was perfectly filled for a Monday night, not crowded so was seated right away. Right next to a big TV. The night seemed to go by so quickly. We were greeted by our waitress for drink orders as soon as we sat down. Not long after food orders, our appetizers came then our main! It was all out within 20 mins, literally. My bf and I started out with the chips & guac. I am picky with guac and theirs is excellent! Our friend ordered the wings and omg, their take on traditional wings is so good! I really only like bbq wings but their traditional wings are so tasty. Next my bf and I shared The Trifecta which is 3 sliders with fries. We were craving burgers/sliders and WOW. Just wow. 3 perfect sized mini burgers with cheese, grilled onions, and spicy mayo on fluffy pretzel buns. Comes with pickles but I opted for them on the side for my bf cos I don't like them. It comes with wonderfully seasoned skinny fries. PERFECT. Just perfect. I'm not sure why it's in the appetizers section but it was the most perfect dish for my bf and I to share to fulfill our craving. I think I could eat these every day if I could. No joke. Our friend ordered the steak salad which visually looked beautiful. Our dinner happened so fast, we ended up just sitting and watching an entire quarter upon finishing. If I wasn't so full, I would have gone for some dessert. I even did some work on my computer there and it picked up their wifi which was nice. Oh, and our water glasses were always always full. The restaurant itself has a real chill vibe and a semi outdoor section with a bonfire pit and corn hole. All in all, love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vigwings
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Trifecta: 3 sliders with skinny fries, extra spicy mayo on the side
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak salad

tuD2bdtJs7c60bALJrlWgg.text: Sad to say, this was the worst I've had in awhile. I started off by getting an egg sandwich with home fries. The home fries weren't seasoned at all and the egg sandwich (breakfast sandwich) was inedible. The tomatoes on the sandwich weren't ripe, the croissant was not durable enough to hold it together + it was soggy, the cheese was over cooked as well as old ingredients were used. My mother had French toast with blueberry compote. The french toast was fine, but the bacon on her plate was molded and also inedible. The manager tried to tell us we were confused, "that's our version of the breakfast sandwich; that was just blueberries on the bacon". The service was terrible as well. After speaking with the manager we waited at least 15 minutes for the check and another 15 minutes before we finally got up and paid at the bar because our waitress never returned. All in all, we were very displeased.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States

E5sGJVA-IDmF5sZmf485vQ.text: Wish they had more tap beers (8) and more local ones.  HH food is great (edamame for $3.50 is a steal, as are the street tacos ($4.50).  By far the best app is the Tandoori Chicken pizza.  Wish all the apps were on their HH menu though.  Excellent service, atmosphere, great outdoor options (front & back), etc.  They have closed captioning on their TVs often, which is really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast on a bun, sub extra arugula for bacon (they were out of spinach). Very good, this is how I&#39;ll order it from now on.

iNyGipNYMVbV6id_c-FxBw.text: Not quite 5 stars, definitely 4.5 though.  My husband and I stopped here for our anniversary dinner as we were driving through Phoenix. They kind of won because most of the restaurants I kept finding on Yelp that I wanted to try ended up being closed on Monday. The Vig was definitely busy on a Monday night, maybe as a result of everyone else being closed.  Monday night is $5 burger night. My husband went for that. He really liked it. He said it wasn't an amazing culinary experience but that you could tell all the ingredients were really high quality. So a delicious, standard burger. Also the mustard that came with the fries was so so so good. It was a curry mustard, genius, I'm totally adding curry powder to my mustard at home now.  I went for the fish taco salad. I'd desribe it more as a fish taco platter. You still get little tortillas so you can make some tacos. You get an intact piece of grilled fish and then a bunch of toppings. I ate everything on that plate. Super tasty.  I got the hot habby drink which is a lot like a margarita with habanero in it. I really enjoyed it and would totally get it again.  The space itself was really cool. They have a lounge, a sweet patio, lots of giant booths and a community table. We ended up at the community table and it was great. If your're there to watch a game you get a great view.   I love that they have a complimentary cab type service to and from there on Friday and Saturdays (I have no idea what the boundaries are). That's such a great idea!  We will definitely check this spot out again when we're in Phoenix.

XcTk6zxJS5DhBV5e2lp85w.text: Ashley was absolutely phenomenal. Making great recommendations on drinks and food. Even though it was very busy she still took the time to make sure I had a great experience. I contemplated leaving 4 stars because they did not offer any mezcal on the menu. Luckily Ashley's bubbly personality made up for the lacking mezcal selection. As long as Ashley is here I will be a return customer weekly. If Ashley Is here and can serve me a delicious mezcal I will be a return customer daily. Great food, great atmosphere, amazing service.

uz-qy2GJkBxvy95JgnL_Ng.text: I've always wanted to try the Vig and never had a chance. Saturday afternoon we were in the area so we decided to try it.   We walked in for lunch and I guess for lunch it's a pick your own table no hostess. Very modern looking. Very interesting inside just can't describe besides very modern. The inside is pretty dark where we sat. They had modern music playing. Pretty upbeat but not rocky.   Anyways, I ordered the Vigazz burger with sweet potato fries. The burger was interesting with grilled red onions, tomatoes, cheese, and greens. It looked really good but tasted ok. Let me put it this way. Not a lot of taste. I really loved the sweet potato fries. Overall, I thought it was an okay meal.   My wife ordered the Turkey sandwich which had tons of turkey with coleslaw and cranberry on a pretzel roll. Nice combination. I stole a quick bite and it was really good.    The service was really good. We were greeted quickly at our table. Drinks were at our table quickly and refills regularly. They even boxed my wife's leftovers.   So overall, we had a really good time. Great relaxing atmosphere, good food, and good service. What else could you ask for. We enjoyed it. I hope you do too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pictures just above our booth
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Picture just above our booth
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey sandwich with sweet potato fries

fvo4L9d9RZDxSgXFRybNVw.text: Go to the midtown location, much better in every regard.   Generally I would give the Vig a big 5 stars, the food is always outstanding so cusps to the chef team. Try the soy garlic edamame and you will never ratio anywhere else. The pazole is a surprising delight. Drinks are always on point.   Unfortunately the service at this one is frequently less then stellar. Assume you will be ignored for the first 10 minutes of your visit, assume you will have to stalk your waiter for another drink. Particularly disappointing this time was when I asked Christian our waiter for a cup of coffee during brunch he gave me "the look" and asked me if I was "really going to make him work". This was of course after we had to ask the bus boy who the hell our winter was after sitting for 15 minutes. While he said he could go to the trouble of brewing a pot of coffee (which would have taken less time then the conversation he proceeded to engage in complaining about it) I passed. We didn't really see him after and that's probably better.

HjT8AHuVp-g5mnsq_brwDA.text: Met up with a friend for Happy Hour at the Vig, it's another place I have been meaning to check out.  I didn't do any research on the place so when I pulled in and my door was opened by some strange man I was sorta thrown off, but overcame that quickly as I walked toward the restaurant.   I didn't see any signs saying it was valet parking, so that's why I was a little caught off guard.  Once inside I got to check out the place , its retro with a cool vibe, I could see how hanging out at the Vig has become popular. My friend and I were headed to another event so eating wasn't really what we were into, but after a quick look at the menu we decided on some guac & chips and grilled fish tacos. The guac was fresh and creamy; the added pico went great with it. The fish tacos though stole the show, the tomatillo & avocado salsa on blacken white fish with spicy slaw, explosion of flavors! I might have to go back soon just for that! So good!  The Vig is a great place to start your happy hour off at, nice drink selection and food choices! Look forward to coming back

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos: blacken whitefish, spicy slaw,pico de gallo, tomatillo &amp; avocado salsa
Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh Guac

7uwQqeHXsW2_3EVtvxCSww.text: I love The Vig Uptown, they have a great Happy Hour ! The Coug Cup is my favorite . The bartender, Annie, was so helpful, upbeat, and makes great drinks! She makes the bar a welcoming warm place to have a drink. Andre the manager is also very amiable and makes sure everyone is taken care of. Can't wait to go back again!

FFGIR2uIyAXlIItJvwR9xw.text: Best grown-up bar anywhere near that part of town. Happy hour burgerettes cheap and delish and filling. All apologies to our friends from the kingdom of Siam, but The Vig has the best Pad Thai on this celestial plane. Excellent beverage choices, fun and happy staff. Very cool, slightly industrial architecture. Valet parking displeases me, but probably forced on them by the neighborhood. An acceptably small downside

iFSpMSQvOSHHoO4yriY0jw.text: My husband & I went here for dinner without the kids. I have a membership to the Elite Restaurant thing, so it was BOGO for dinner entre. We had the pork belly & watermelon appetizer and that was delicious! I had the adult mac & cheese and my hubs had a burger. The food was good. We sat in the back area and it was really loud. There was a DJ (not that great) and a group of people playing corn hole that were just so loud and carrying on about the game...it was kind of annoying. Lots of f-bombs being dropped...not that I have I have virgin ears but come on!    The service was excellent, wait staff was attentive and friendly.   The one thing I did not like at all is that you pretty much have to valet park your car and I had no cash on me...luckily I was able to tip an additional $5 and the waitress gave me the $5 in cash.  We will try their other locations soon!

oQcxv5XQbSoNxkqlHgaguA.text: I was in town for conference and we ordered and brought back to the conference hall.  Ordered the Lean and Green Steak.  Wow!  Steak was lean, tender and cooked to perfection.  The salad was huge, fresh and delicious.  Enjoyed the grilled veggies too! If I ever come back to Phoenix again, I will eat in house.  Highly recommend!!

yDNfUe-Lngt_6lJfNi-e5w.text: This place is over rated . They have minimum 10 people serving or helping serve and still slow and unresponsive service. The food is alright.But the service is ridiculous . Once you get drinks and order in you never see any one near your table or they ignore you. I have been here multiple times and same bad service every time . All the times I go it is slow in restaurant so no excuse they are to busy.  Well if you wanna feel cool and hip but bad service and mediocre food here is your place

-KnZ2t_LZ4goY6YRTMYFDw.text: Very hipstery not a lot of food choices they have a small specific menu -drinks are small and over priced

4bpWD96wfgA60Bl42Fp_6g.text: The kind of place that rather than re-making your drink... tops it off with sprite and pawns it off as a new one. It would worked, had he not left the same ice cube I put into my rambling rose...... terrible.... Arcadia and Filmore are way more passionate and attentive. This one is ran like a f#*king joke... However, if you're looking for a super sweet Manhattan, I guess this place is for you. Best pace for sugar and water!!!!

OQPNSX-ZPfFq_2RwNWSwaA.text: I'm sitting here still at the vig waiting for about 20 minutes while our waitress Sierra  chit chats away with the host Instead of  checking us out. This has absolutely been the worst experience I've ever had. I usually go to the downtown vig but decided to come to this location since it's closer. Boy do I regret this so much. She didn't take our kids drinks orders and walked off in the middle of me trying to place my order which was extremely rude. All of our drinks remained empty for most of our meals. This will be my last time coming.

xoCDqzl_xy96DJ7qngzTbw.text: Went to the Vig Uptown on a wonderfully warm Saturday afternoon, for a burger & beer. Hubby had been before and knew I'd like it!- Yes. I did. Got a booth & it was a bit of a wait for our server to get drink order- but it was the end of lunch crowd & we were not in a hurry by any means. Drafts were nice & cold. We placed our orders, Hubby always has a request for simple/basic burger where ever we go & our Server was able to get it done for him & it was 'really good!'. I got the Black bean burger w'/ side o'Mac n Cheese. Burger was great, Mac was a bit watery-( but I'm OK with just about any Mac!..I ate it all & could have had more.) Love the decor and atmosphere. Will return for sure.

dtotRblBQILZDEE9gTt_dw.text: I've now joined the many previous reviewers who are fans of The Vig.   I'm not from Phoenix, but I travel there a lot for work so I try to find new places to try whenever I'm there.    I took my sales team there for dinner and we reserved one of the back patio couch areas for dinner and drinks.  What a great place!   I loved that back patio area and the bocci and corn hole options.   We were a larger group so we had 2 servers and both were amazing.  Extremely attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.  The food is upscale bar food, so there was something for everyone.   Even my colleague with some dietary restrictions.  We ordered several apps for the table including guacamole, edamame, and their charcuterie board. All was quite delicious.   Everyone ordered their own thing but I had the short rib tacos and they were amazing!  The meat was extremely tender and had a fantastic tasting asian sweet glaze.   The drinks were tasty, strong, and reasonably priced.   All in all, this was a fantastic evening out.  Although I say I like to try new places whenever I travel to Phoenix, I will most likely return to The Vig.  Great place!

2CetXYJAKO6UeEuoOvRk8g.text: Clean, Quick, Friendly, Yummy.  Overall I'm a fan of the Vig restaurants; they always have good flavor and the vibe is relaxed, always a diverse crowd and at this location, I've never had an issue getting a table.  Prices are comparable to other restaurants in the area and if you're just looking for a guaranteed place for a group of people and relax, here is  your spot && their Happy Hour will support that :)   Personally, I'm a fan of their appetizer/small plate menu ... give me the wings...all the wings...any day.  But if it's happy hour, I'll order the entire happy hour menu too...even though I wont be able to eat it all on my own...it's all delicious. But for real the wings :) :) :) :) :) :)  // cheers //

Pa717in0X-C_PEfhji-Ntg.text: Their food is usually really good, but I think they are confused what a charcuterie board is, which is super odd especially because (1) it's a wine bar and (2) they are literally at every restaurant. I don't know anyone who will spend $17 for grapes, a strawberry, a tiny slice of old prosciutto and cheap salami that tastes like old refrigerator and the *rind* of Brie cheese when the Whining Pig is practically next door.   Luckily the server was really nice, super understanding  and took the charcuterie board away and brought us out the Best Turkey sandwich, which is quite literally the best turkey sandwich and a burger for my husband.

BjLcy2JexWL9FKtw-XzAhA.text: My husband and I went on a Friday night; it was very busy and had a long wait but we easily found a spot at the bar. The bartender was very nice and attentive. She was able to make a virgin drink for me that was delicious, which a lot of bartenders can't do (they only know how to do virgin margaritas). My husband got the wings; I don't even like wings and thy were delicious! I ordered charred broccoli which I love and it was delish also. The only caution is the chocolate cake. It was absolutely flavorless. My husband and I both tried it and it was awful. Everything else was great and we would highly recommend.

s1lr60hNLMFlRj3Ps6V5wg.text: We came in on Tuesday not knowing about the special, it wasn't too crowded but there was a party happening on the covered patio so we sat in the booth near the patio which was still nice. Our server Sierra did a great job explaining the special to us and the tacos and margarita were amazing. She also convinced us to try the butter scotch cake and i don't think I have ever made a better decisions. Would definitely recommend coming here, and I cannot wait to come back again!

PjUENL_x3oh3t1zIRPfIyA.text: Good burgers, really interesting salsa.  I also like the occasional live music and the friendly service.  Only complaint is the omnipresent valet parking.  Just stupid, especially for locals like me.  Park down the block.

f6tMiOOyjOj_dDeXgcJHwg.text: Their valet sucks! They took apart my keychain and neglected to return it to me. I have no clue what possessed them to take apart my keys and the fact that they "forgot" to return my full keychain to me blows my mind! It's rude!

qjpHOGsCnRq22oThlj5_hw.text: Love this place so much!!! Everything about this place is awesome!!!! I recommend any to come here if you want to enjoy a relaxed dinner or brunch with friends!!

XEcINaXXgauXLYsVsLI3jA.text: I've only been here for drinks.  With that said, the Verde Valley is awesome!  I come here for happy hour on occasion and enjoy drinking those.  The bartender girl with straight and short blonde hair is always pleasant and I receive good service.  Drinks are a bit pricy on "regular hours"   However the service is good, and the drinks are tasty!

UROiaAJqx1OZaxUpRdOUQQ.text: Found this place out cause of my aunt. Food is really delicious, and good prices. Imagine a modern yet fancy place for every group. Place is busy towards the weekend, and recommend calling to see how busy it is too reserve a table.   valet parking is free.

6_IMUmNHTe2nhgJ5Ycogyg.text: Nothing like ordering Postmates from The Vig and opening your steak salad only to immediately see a piece of plastic sitting on top of it. Wow. It even has some dried black gooo in the middle, like they clipped the top of a chocolate dispenser and the ring landed in my salad. Well, I figured I'd separate that garbage out of my food and eat, I'm hungry. First bite I put in my mouth is an ice cold (if not thawing) piece of squash. If I wanted something plastic and frozen I would have went to McDonalds or something!. Won't be ordering The Vig again... thanks for the $24 edamame!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check your salads for garbage

xVGpk1H6aIAGuq9lH_MElw.text: I want to know why you can NEVER get my Postmates order correct. Why is the food never consistent? I again cannot eat my food. A huge waste of money.

Ec1exsYbqQ4XR8Niik-IzQ.text: I love coming to this location. Rochelle is a great bartender and so helpful. The food is great and the service has always been outstanding.

xMljvj7Wbfa6vA9ShubQ1A.text: I know I'm biased because I've been to this place so many times times,  but it really is the ideal sophisticated chill spot. I can bring any of my friends or family here and I'd know they'd love it.   Great patio,  with a casual yet modern vibe that can be enjoyed at any time of day.  The bartenders are always super friendly,  and there's usually a drink special going on.  I went this Sunday with a girlfriend and had their $3 mimosas, and it wasn't in a tiny champagne flute it was full on wine glass full.  The Chicken Sandwich I ordered was tender with a nice,  fluffy ciabatta accompanied with some tangy pesto and sun-dried tomatoes. I ordered the Brussel sprouts as well which were cooked perfectly. Great food,  service,  and drinks. Love this midtown bar!

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich with Brussel Sprouts

Vin9qmll9QCD_PmKQ0DdAg.text: The Vig is one of my favorite places to hit up! Being in the industry it's hard to find good places with awesome food at a later hour. The soy garlic edamame is amazing. My server Ashley took care of everything we needed and made sure our drinks were never left empty and plates weren't crowding our table! Definitely would recommend!

USGqhrpYwHVj7jpmooFaxw.text: Must have Posole!  ... Posole Pozole who cares this is legit!  You can always count on a great dinning experience at the Vig.

61oreKfnXC0y5XoPCZ-_fA.text: WOW!  Just amazing! Love the food and the atmosphere.  My family and I were around the area, and just decided to yelp what was around us and the Vig came up.  I have heard of the Vig before from my co workers, but they failed to mention the deliciousness of the food!  Since it was a quick snack, my daughter (under 2) got the edamame for snacks and the wife ordered some sliders and I got the chicken wings.  Edamame tasted fresh! OMG, the slider, I would go back to the Vig alone and just to order those sliders.  The wings, had a good taste, but TRUST ME, get the sliders.

1hEV_R-PPBD77Z85_KjoJw.text: I always drive by this location and have heard raving reviews about it.  Now I know why because the food was outstanding!  We went for brunch....breakfast sandwich was on point and so was the Bloody Mary bar!  I see myself coming here more often now that I know first hand!  Thank you for great Food and service!

r_-JfYuddZORpinWjEzlLg.text: bad service, total disrespect seen alot of good paying customers being thrown out. kitchen infested with cockroaches i do not see how they are still open wish the healthy inspector would see it. the place is just nasty and should be shut down. to any future customers i would recommend not eating here

r4HQS3b-SWh56v-Gx6_IFQ.text: Went to the Vig again after 5 years. My original review is still correct. But I'd say 3 star not 2.  Food was good, not great. The vig is Pricey for Burgers. Looks like a great place to drink- we don't drink. Staff was Very friendly- all of them.   Parking is Valet only...  :(  Ordered ice tea, plain. Received some sort of flavored tea...I hate that. My husband Loved the Arnold  Palmer he ordered. Shoe string fries, ok. Onion rings very tasty.

OkViMUIKoYExq847gZEpdg.text: We were really looking forward to getting together with friends and catching up over a good meal. We arrived at 6:15 on a Friday night and were pleased to see it wasnt super crowded. We were seated outside on a beautiful evening. Unforunately, a group with about 15-20 gymnastists were there too! They appeared to be in the 7-10 yr old range. They were running around screaming in their high-pitched little girl voices! The parents did NOTHING to quiet them down. I have no problem with bringing kids to a restsurant, but this was over the top loud and obnoxious. We couldnt even talk! The employees didnt say anything to the girls or their parents. I asked the girls twice to be a little bit quieter to no avail. We couldnt leave fast enough. So disappointed. The food was decent but we will never go back!

PpJwAmdvofB_z1GwT3u1vA.text: Went into the vig for lunch expecting good service, but Sierra delivered EXCELLENT service. Very impressed by her attentiveness and dedication to great customer service. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to grab a bite to eat!

6e3GGTTm9lw-IVBTuoX9-g.text: Love this place. Very cozy, warm and inviting atmosphere. Choice of two patios (one of them has fireplace), great service and great burgers. Prices are reasonable. Will be back!

fo85b3LHoxrnBdKGGHlbpg.text: I swore I would never go back to The Vig Uptown because of the service but the last two times I was in I had Jazz as my server. She is attentive, efficient and engaging. She is great and I will only go back to sit in her section! If you go, please ask for her section!

ODxgpmeJCkGhNh51uYPkhQ.text: Get there for HH on a Friday at 345 and sit outside.  After an easy 5 minutes without a server we move to the bar. Place was dead by the way and we weren't even acknowledged when we walked in. Service was better at the bar and food was pretty good (Sliders and Calamari). Friends Old Fashion was super strong too. Time to go and we head out to the complimentary valet...they couldn't find my friend keys. After 5 minutes I look over and can see the car in the lot. I notice the drivers window is down so I walk over there and the damn keys are in the car and it's running...!  None of the valets had any idea about it or could tell is how long it was running. For all we know it was running the entire time we were there...just over 2 hours.   Really doubt I'll be going back anytime soon.

L-WmwIaOhmif2CxDA_ur2w.text: An old standby! Besides being a very cool venue, a repurposed MCM bank, the service and atmosphere is always spot on! Tonight Memphis was our server/bartender and was delightful, charming and new the menu like the back of a five dollar bill! The staff is always attentive, friendly and quick with a recommendation.

MkmmxpSymAP6gmQPTlNjqw.text: While the menu selection is not the biggest, the atmosphere and food are worth it! Got great attention from the staff as well :) My 2nd time coming here I will for sure be coming back!

J1ynnVTjYxCvddX-IsZp3Q.text: "Extremely Cool Without Being Pretentious"  Second time at the Vig Uptown.  Brunch.  Just really cool modern surroundings... but not just surface modern, but deep modern aesthetics that just feel comfortable and real.  Sat in the atrium type outside, which is really like an inside garage with big windows and air conditioning.  It's like being outside in the best temperature in Phoenix, even if it's over 100 degrees.  Food was very good.  Relatively large portions for an upscale establishment.  My wife had the $15 salmon, recommended by the server as the best thing on the menu, and it did not disappoint.  Would easily cost 2x at other restaurants, and probably be worth it.   I had the Hangover cure, and it was easily enough food to take home and have for breakfast the next day.  Very tasty for $10.  And I got the $3 spicy bloody mary that came with it, which was one of the best bloody mary's I've ever had.  At noon, on the Sunday we went, a really nice band came in and played some great acoustic rock, very nice.    It was one of the best brunch experiences we've had in Phoenix.  Add to this the fact that all wine on the menu, if ordered by the bottle, is 50% off, and that's an outstanding deal.  We'll be back.  I kicked myself for not coming back sooner.    My five star is a rating that is influenced by pricing.  I am a cheap bastard with expensive tastes, so I reward a restaurant that I not only feel I had great food, nice ambiance, and good service, but that I got my money's worth.  And The Vig Uptown is all that and then some.  I strongly recommend it to all.

RFqLRs5y34yY52dsUIE45Q.text: I came here to end my night and wasn't sure what I was expecting. First I saw a bar, then I saw a lounge area with a focal point of a fire-less fireplace. I liked it. Very loungy, very laid back. Surprisingly empty due to the fact that it was a Saturday after payday - but then again, my premonitions of people behavior is rarely correct.   I had a drink, and I had a massively loaded plate of hummus. Very tasty. My party was worn out, and besides that I think this place could be a perfect place to unwind. The atmosphere was relaxed and friendly, even if the oh-so-stereotypical DJ tried his best to lay tracks that no one was interested in. (DJs fascinates me - due to the lack of originality in their appearance.)  I don't think I have more to say about this place - it wasn't what I expected, and I think that is a relief.

mp5mJr280X1ppsdHTRTXUQ.text: There seems to be a lot of reviews about poor service on here but I can say that when I came in with a group on a busy Saturday night, we were well taken care of!  I loved the food here. Incredibly indulgent, yet so divine. I also order their drink called "Take Bethany Home" as it had cucumber and watermelon and I thought would be pretty refreshing after already being toasty, but it was fairly disappointing. :-/   Otherwise all expectations were met or exceeded!

hMiWi5t1TjXkHX4gVKFtoQ.text: When someone asks me where to eat in town, my default answer is the vig.  The vig; uptown, definitely has my heart.  The stylish interior sets the perfect mood during the day for a relaxing meal, or at night if you're looking for the nightlife.   The meals are simple yet exquisite to the taste. If you're having trouble choosing a meal, go for the hot chick. The Hot chick consist of a great tasting spicy chicken sandwich; I'll leave the rest of the description for your taste buds.  The drinks are cheap and one of the best in the city. I had a gin cucumber, the bartender recommended me and I adopted this drink as my go to favorite.

PplJ49kGY_0MZM3EjLMESg.text: Came after 10 pm and was greeted very well by the hostess. Had a few cocktails, the daily mule was absolutely perfect! We had for munchies the sliders appetizer with sweet potato fries. Can you say yummy! The sliders were perfect on soft pretzel buns with tasty beef and oh my gosh the toppings were to kill for! This is such a great late night hang out spot

1q614Cc24QCH_V45e-JuTg.text: What a waste of a drive. Went to grab some late night food because the hours posted were till 12pm on a Monday. Arrived at 11:02 to see a full bar, but all the chairs on top of the tables. The bartender was nice, and even made it seem like he was going out of his way to offer me a last call drink, even though they were closed.  Who closes when there are still 15 guests and the hours say open till 12:00?  Guess it's another one of those situations where the staff picks the hours of operation rather than the owners who actually post them. Too bad, waned to spend my money, but guess it will go to another establishment.

_8JfooaK9ycbHq-usWVkyQ.text: The service is terrible Not only did Bill loose my reservation everyone that works there so "cool" that they cannot be bothered to help you.   It is pretentious, unfriendly, kaotic and totally without an appreciation for the customer.  Never again

4VhnyeJHeWeLHmhJ8pj3mw.text: I gotta say this place had a great atmosphere. Good food. But consistently BAD SERVICE. Whether its giving happy hour menus outside of happy hour. Not filling drinks. Serving burnt food. I'd say its just very up and down here. They still often have some good deals and can be fun.  HOWEVER, even though this place is VERY close to my house I finally stopped going due to their refusal to have to play a Broncos game over a local Coyotes game. All 3 TVs were on the Broncos, and wouldn't switch just one tv. We ended up leaving and discovering Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers in old town and haven't been back since.

RmU73YVqXDJwmN-O41fB6A.text: Jason was a bad ass super nice server .   I had turkey sandwich it was super good just happened to pop in this place and never been before but I'll definitely be back

qM26x1XB2ld0qZ3yHGoNpw.text: Sunday. food good. Posole yes. 5 bloody Mary bar. Takes a long time for them to replenish bar though, bacon, olives, green beans,  etc. But service holy slow. 10 minutes to run card. Really? Asked hostess if understaffed,  she says no really busy, um not that busy. So your understaffed,  because you plan for this, Sunday brunch crowd

gRJSTr3_8avw1fnTM6e7rg.text: I go to the VIG Uptown with a group of friends every couple of weeks. We always ask for our favorite server, Memphis. She is the best. And the food is good too. I love the Poszole,  Edamame, Hot Vings, Burgers and the blackened chicken BLT.

2e7FcURiPF1lF7QQ9LxZ8g.text: Our waitress was hugging and hanging on her girlfriend while working. Unprofessional!!!

dhmHEF_5P1rx2WsA7gB96A.text: Another fun hangout place with good food. My group sat outside near the cornhole area. After eating the achiote salmon (which i recommend!) and ahi tuna salad (which was... ok), my friends and I played a couple rounds of the cornhole game (..... I think that's what it's called). The beer selection was good, as well. A lot of mid-20 to mid-30 year olds here...

3xtu1ps4pRk5Qt6Dn5hsdw.text: Great food! Went at 1:00 on Sunday. GET RID OF THE INSIPID MUSIC EXPERIENCE. I am a musician and it does nothing for your restaurant. The dj experience with the the saxophone player added in is annoying at best

Ffrf7Eenp9bNyqFiGr2xqw.text: We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon.  It was the first really hot weekend so we appreciated that it was dark in side.  I'm one of those who likes to get out of the glaring sun.  We sat at the bar.  The bartenders were super friendly and chatty, which is unusual for Phoenix.  We both ordered the steak salad.  It was good, but not great.  Standard bar food.  For me The Vig is a place to meet friends and have a drink.  I gave three stars because I really like The Vig.  I'll add stars if the food improves.

CH-njdHJjPZYMLnWOkzulQ.text: The Vig Uptown is indeed a pillar of the 16th Street and Bethany area. It is one of the larger drinking establishments in this beloved district of North Central Phoenix, along with Z Tejas and Zipps. Like its brethren, it's a solid choice-decent food, an assortment of beverages, and a comfortable, lively environment suitable for groups small or large. If you want something a little different in this area, try some of the smaller bars, such as the Whining Pig or Swizzle Inn.  Valet parking is available when its busy, and they have an extra parking area north on 16th street just past the Shasta Pools store.

ic-nnWklvjNBOtlXJZyvCQ.text: Ugh. Bad. Requested no onions or dressing and it came with both. Waitress wasn't around for 15 minutes (empty drinks) and I was too hungry to wait for her to fix it. When I finally did see her she took my order and ignored my date. Needless to say she lost money we would've spent on more drinks. The drinks were good, though.

bWtncn5X0aU3Sx7Oh-gi0w.text: I love the patio here. Its technically inside, but has huge windows.  Just like The Vig, Uptown has great drinks and food. Their guac and burgers are delicious to point out a few. the only thing I wouldnt recommend on their menu is their cheesy tots, unless you dont mind the lack of cheese.

L4C8Wj23Ghrp0P9tdmn3XQ.text: WOW! We are from out of town & this spot was near our hotel and open late, so we decided to try it out for a late dinner after a 6 hour drive. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked inside. We could seat ourselves so we decided to sit in the courtyard area where there was plenty of open tables. There was a warm fire pit surrounded by tables and benches. They had Trivial Pursuit cards on all the tables and there was an area with bean bags to play cornhole. There was live music, two gentleman playing guitar with voices like angels. We sat and listened until they ended their set because they were THAT GOOD! We had some drinks which were delicious and not light on the pour. We had a few appetizers (Edamame and the Spinach, Artichoke, Jalapeno Dip) and for entrees we had the 3 Cheese Mac & Cheese and the Shrimp Pad Thai. All of which were delicious. We had an amazing mudslide in a mason jar for dessert. We had an amazing night here & we will probably be stopping back in while we are in town! Highly recommend!

a13YmR_oxpDdSyj-ygihAw.text: The eggs Benedict is to die for! Always a great ambience and relaxing. Highly recommend!!

IrEvbEEGO-WAf2DPoVwP_w.text: What an awesome experience! This is an adaptive reuse project that rivals Parlor or St Francis in every way.  The inside is gorgeous with bright colors, natural textures, and inviting seating.  The outside is bright, airy, shaded, and relaxing.  I can't say enough about the amazing renovation that was done to this old bank.  Being that I've never been to the Arcadia version, I wasn't exactly sure what to expect.  Since the primary reason I had never been to the Arcadia site is the parking nightmare, I was not surprised to see a similar issue here.  We, luckily, showed up at 4 before they got slammed and were able to park right up front.  We were seated on the patio and loved everything about it.    Our waitress was Raven (whom John H also recommends) and she was great.  Very helpful and friendly.  I have to say, for an upscale place with a snooty vibe, the service was impeccable!  She kept our drinks full and kept the table clear of used dishes.  We started with the crab and artichoke dip.  It came with these weird sweet potato chips that were covered in some spice combination I couldn't quite place.  The chips were thick and firm with a lot of flavor.  The dip was full of crab (surprising) and had a great texture to it.  I really enjoyed it.  For my entree I had a pork tenderloin salad.  It was possibly the strangest looking thing on the menu and I just couldn't resist.  The tenderloin was sliced into about 9 pieces and displayed very nicely over the bed of arugula, dried fruit, hazelnuts, and some wicked lemon dressing.  It was an awesome combo that was EXACTLY what I had been looking for that day.  Really enjoyed it!  Happy hour is something like 3-6 with half off most appetizers and like $2 off drinks.  The menu is pricey but not Scottsdale pricey and I feel like the value is there.  Sit outside, if you can.  You won't regret it.  I'm glad we went for the opening because I doubt I'll ever be able to get back in here once the neighborhood finds out what a jewel they have.

photos.caption: Photo of The Vig Uptown - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Herb garden by the entrance

NcoVT4Ub73zHsD2bTvHKzw.text: I used to love this place. However, me and my gf came here on a sat at 4pm. Parking lot was empty. We told valet we didn't have any cash and asked if we can park our own car. Seemed like a good deal for me since he didn't have to do his job for free. He declined and told us to park across the street. I thought valet was setup to be a convenience.. However it was an inconvenience for us to run through traffic with heels on. You lost business today.

fEE-Sxh2XDWyEwgDqMPs8A.text: Server Lindsey was very knowledgable about the drink menu and made a few recommendations I happily obliged. I would definitely come back here again.

ERqR5DIS63kHtthBNqAYeg.text: I thought this Vig would never win over MY Vig near my home in Biltmore. Hmmmm... well so far it did. I met my boyfriend here because it's near his office. I loved the patio. More so than Arcadia. Not that it's a competition. I like the bar out back too. Not that I had drinks in the mid of the afternoon! I had a international trip to fly later that day. It's super trendy...as is the other Vig. Cool atmosphere and very busy. Complimentary valet. I like that , if they are gonna force a valet on you, for sure. I had the seasonal salad: shrimp, cojita cheese, greens, pear, I had them hold the carmelized nuts, and balsamic on the side. I loved it! My boyfriend had the salmon...It came on a corn cake, with mango salsa. All plates clean. Winner , Winner this Vig's a Winner.

NNipRSCLkyzex9GIwz2DMA.text: We started with the cheesy tater tots. Really different. They were like very large fried tater tots but there was melted american cheese inside; served with two dips; one jalapeno mayo and the other ketchup. We would order them again!    My wife had the roast beef sandwich on a pretzel bun, stuffed full of roast beef, melted cheese and a large bowl of au jus as a dipping medium, we asked that the chipotle mayo be served on the side and it proved a worthy dip as well.   Fries (seasoned) were perfectly crisp (a little too salty for me but still very good).   I had the sliders...excellent, lots of food inside the mini pretzel buns on which they were served.   We shared the Banana Bread Pudding dessert, also excellent. Our first visit and glad we came.   The waitress (don't know her name but she volunteered that she was from Memphis) was excellent, checked on the table frequently without being intrusive.

6vohpCP6eFGN7ayXuAOOsA.text: First time here. Pad thai okay with plenty of shrimp, chicken and tofu. Juicier than traditional Thai food. Good service. Deconstructed taco looked good. Enough food with each meal.

Wfot-ZPJzh7mpaWoUQhoUg.text: Been here a couple times. The wait staff sort of ignores you and you almost have to scream and stand up with flash lights to get their attention. WEAK!! that or they can't hear over the noise. Anyways they definitely wont give you any time if you aren't in their section...  Good stuff, um $5 burger Mondays is pretty cool.  I WOULD NOT pay their regular price for their burgers because they aren't on that caliber to be asking that much for them.  The rest of their food is good. not great. Fun atmosphere except when you get kids running around and screaming like banshees. That might contribute to the annoyed wait staff, cause they have to dodge them constantly.   I'd be back...but probably on a...you guessed it...a Monday.

jDph2YTLFQmIk4rVs4BbtA.text: OK, here's my comparison of the two Vigs:    The Vig is better than Uptown when the weather is nice and it's not too hot.  There's nothing better than being outside on the back patio listening to live music.  The Vig Uptown will be better in the middle of summer.  It's nice and open and airy and will be much cooler.  I was at Uptown yesterday and got a nice seat at the bar and enjoyed watching the Dbacks game on a large flat screen in hi def.  I had a $4 margarita that was on happy hour special.  It was well made so I had a second and just chilled out watching the game.  It was the perfect mid-afternoon break.  I'm not wild about having to valet park but that's the way it goes.  I wish that I lived a little closer so that I could get to both of the Vigs more often.

ShwloQR4WuncWVQUEQ2GOg.text: Been here a few times over the past 3 years and I have yet to have a bad experience. The staff has always been courteous, prices are decent and the atmosphere is inviting.   My favorite time is happy hour. The Vig has a nice variety of food and beverages on their happy hour menu. You can enjoy sitting inside or out in the covered yard area. I prefer the yard area because it is more open.   I would give the Vig 5 stars if it weren't for the lack of parking spaces and need to use their valet service. I like to have the option.

lxuVmcaI4SorstMBwId9Kw.text: Cute little restaurant with an urban feel.  A friend and I sat at the bar and order cocktails and light appetizers.  The grill fish tacos was a hit for me.  Small yet flavorful and the Moscow Mule made with the TX liquor was outstanding.

c3uY8TFiGc2CkJsw01dHEQ.text: Very cool place.  Nice setting. Good food and drinks. Waitresses were very attentive. It was a little loud, but that was thr only problem I had with it. I would definitely go there again.

wteOIC41WpnjwQmfBpZ4xQ.text: Me and some girlfriends met up for dinner here this past Sunday night. The hostess was so gracious in trying to hold a table for us but alas a few members of my party were tardy so we ended up by the fire pit area which was very nice. Our waiter William a.k.a Billy was AWESOME! I swear he went above and beyond the call of duty that night.  Sunday nights (and day for that matter) are half off bottles of wine. Between that and their awesome menu, what more can you ask for. I ordered the Vigazz burger which was huge, messy and oh so good. Top that with a side order of sweet potato fries and I was in heaven. All the ladies seemed to enjoy their meals as well, from various sandwiches to the warm apple cobbler that another friend ordered. I am not a fan of cooked fruit but let me tell you, that was some good tasting apple cobbler.  Billy evenly split all our bills up down to the wine. I swear he was the best. I do prefer this location over the other as it is bigger and you are able to spread out. If you happen to be in the area, definitely stop on by. I doubt you will be disappointed.

4XLQSdkj7SKM4qDFlJO0sg.text: The steak on my salad was excellent but the rest of the salad was bland. Would not recommend cheese tater tots. They need more waiters. There was one girl to 10 tables it was a mess! Also desserts were disappointing and the drinks overpriced.

b69hqc4zym-AcdbvSqAZog.text: My first review ever! Love edamame sauce!!! Amazing! I love it so much I put it on everything I ordered-- I was even trying to think if I can patent this and sell it to sriracha. Any way I have tried a little bit of the mac n cheese which also amazing and I think this sauce would make the Mac n cheese the best in the world- this idea sounds so good that I would be willing to take a whole bottle of lactose intolerant pills to eat it.

3k2fign13OaGupNV2kWX8w.text: Food was awesome,  spots from the bar were weak with only mixers and not strong. ..stay away from them and stick wirh water here

B72Q02WuUAcVf8z1Vqenkg.text: I really like this place a lot!  I've been here a few times and the food has always been excellent and reasonably priced.   If you go, the "Hot Totties" are a must appetizer! They are so good! As for entrees, I've had both the "Vigazz" and "Arcadia" burgers. Both are excellent. Plus! If you go Monday after 6, the Arcadia burger is only 5 bucks! Down from I believe 11 dollars. The last time I went I had the pot roast dinner and it was absolutely fantastic. It was a rather large portion cooked to perfection.  Just a heads up though, this place is always busy. So be prepared to wait a little for a table.   I went to this place a couple of days ago, it was a Thursday night and it was packed. Because it's always busy, some times the servers will forget about you.   It took a few minutes for a server to acknowledge my wife and I, we didn't have utensils when our meal came, the server didn't check on us. We had three different people who had taken our order, got us our food and gave us the check.   To be fair though there was a rather large party next to us, 20-plus people, so I'm sure that had an influence on how our servers took care of us.   All-in-all, I'd come back and recommend this place. I really need to hit this place up for happy hour! Half-price appetizers? Yum!

e4F0ReQrfRxSjq8tZ89jOQ.text: Came into the Vig for date night. We could not be more happier with the service. Eduardo was very welcoming. Thank you!

VJo2-iOuyAWAwQM2udnpXA.text: Nice place to spend Saturday night with friends for dinner and drinks, also can come with kiddos, good food, pleasant atmosphere, reasonable prices!!!!

sGtVOra1JVMzQX6cbhOl3Q.text: Came to The Vig Uptown for a drink and was greeted by our awesome waitress Lindsey. Wasn't sure what I wanted and she helped me make up my mind right away. She was back before my drink my empty to get me another. I love this place and will be back again sometime soon!

ULjEmya-d66px-abHlQ-nA.text: On the few occasions I have been to The Vig it certainly seems a truly cool neighborhood spot. Each time has been a good experience; although I've also experienced the occasional "lapse" in service when the server/waitress disappeared for long, extended periods of time that did not go over well with my guests. The bigger issue I have is, in this day and age, any organization worth its salt not having a decent website seems obscene. If anyone attempts to find information via thevig.us; which seems their official website, they will be sadly, and for me, unbelievably, disappointed. Only via reading YELP was I able to ascertain that there is in fact a Happy Hour; although I still don't know the hours and what are the "offerings" for Happy Hour. Additionally, what restaurant doesn't have their menu, hours, etc. available for all the world to see? It is a shame, and makes me say, "Really?" The Vig cannot find a decent website designer and manager, or worse, is it just not important?
